00068   void
00069   parseFileEntry(const std::string &in, 
00070      std::string &out, unsigned int &nev, unsigned long long &sz)
00071   {
00072     unsigned int no;
00073     stringstream pippo;
00074     pippo << in;
00075     pippo >> no >> out >> nev >> sz;
00076   }
00077 
00078   void
00079   checkDirectoryOK(xdata::String const& p)
00080   {
00081     struct stat64 buf;
00082     // The const-cast is needed because xdata::String::toString() is
00083     // not declared const.
00084     string path(const_cast<xdata::String&>(p).toString());
00085     
00086     int retVal = stat64(path.c_str(), &buf);
00087     if(retVal !=0 )
00088       {
00089   edm::LogError("StorageManager") << "Directory or file " << path
00090           << " does not exist. Error=" << errno ;
00091   throw cms::Exception("StorageManager","checkDirectoryOK")
00092     << "Directory or file " << path << " does not exist. Error=" << errno << std::endl;
00093       }
00094   }
00095 }

00097 
00098 static void deleteSMBuffer(void* Ref)
00099 {
00100   // release the memory pool buffer
00101   // once the fragment collector is done with it
00102   stor::FragEntry* entry = (stor::FragEntry*)Ref;
00103   toolbox::mem::Reference *ref=(toolbox::mem::Reference*)entry->buffer_object_;
00104   ref->release();
00105 }

00379 
00381 void StorageManager::receiveRegistryMessage(toolbox::mem::Reference *ref)
00382 {
00383   // get the memory pool pointer for statistics if not already set
00384   if(pool_is_set_ == 0)
00385   {
00386     pool_ = ref->getBuffer()->getPool();
00387     pool_is_set_ = 1;
00388   }
00389 
00390   I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME         *stdMsg  = (I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME*) ref->getDataLocation();
00391   I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME *msg = (I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME*) stdMsg;
00392 
00393   FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Received registry message from HLT " << msg->hltURL
00394              << " application " << msg->hltClassName << " id " << msg->hltLocalId
00395              << " instance " << msg->hltInstance << " tid " << msg->hltTid
00396              << " rbBufferID " << msg->rbBufferID << " outModID " << msg->outModID
00397              << " fuProcID " << msg->fuProcID  << " fuGUID 0x" << std::hex
00398              << msg->fuGUID << std::dec << std::endl;
00399   FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: registry size " << msg->dataSize << "\n";
00400 
00401   int len = msg->dataSize;
00402 
00403   // *** check the Storage Manager is in the Ready or Enabled state first!
00404   if(fsm_.stateName()->toString() != "Enabled" && fsm_.stateName()->toString() != "Ready" )
00405   {
00406     LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),
00407                        "Received INIT message but not in Ready/Enabled state! Current state = "
00408                        << fsm_.stateName()->toString() << " INIT from " << msg->hltURL
00409                        << " application " << msg->hltClassName);
00410     // just release the memory at least - is that what we want to do?
00411     ref->release();
00412     return;
00413   }
00414 
00415   // 04-Nov-2008, HWKC and KAB - make local copy of I2O message header so
00416   // that we can use that information even after the Reference is released.
00417   // Do *NOT* use the dataPtr() method of the localMsgCopy because this
00418   // copy operation doesn't include the data, only the header!
00419   I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME localMsgCopy;
00420   const char* from = static_cast<const char*>(ref->getDataLocation());
00421   unsigned int msize = sizeof(I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME);
00422   char* dest = (char*) &localMsgCopy;
00423   std::copy(from, from+msize, dest);
00424   localMsgCopy.dataSize = msize;
00425 
00426   // If running with local transfers, a chain of I2O frames when posted only has the
00427   // head frame sent. So a single frame can complete a chain for local transfers.
00428   // We need to test for this. Must be head frame, more than one frame
00429   // and next pointer must exist.
00430   int is_local_chain = 0;
00431   if(msg->frameCount == 0 && msg->numFrames > 1 && ref->getNextReference())
00432   {
00433     // this looks like a chain of frames (local transfer)
00434     toolbox::mem::Reference *head = ref;
00435     toolbox::mem::Reference *next = 0;
00436     // best to check the complete chain just in case!
00437     unsigned int tested_frames = 1;
00438     next = head;
00439     while((next=next->getNextReference())!=0) ++tested_frames;
00440     FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: INIT Head frame has " << tested_frames-1
00441                << " linked frames out of " << msg->numFrames-1 << std::endl;
00442     if(msg->numFrames == tested_frames)
00443     {
00444       // found a complete linked chain from the leading frame
00445       is_local_chain = 1;
00446       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Leading frame contains a complete linked chain"
00447                  << " - must be local transfer" << std::endl;
00448       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Breaking the chain" << std::endl;
00449       // break the chain and feed them to the fragment collector
00450       next = head;
00451 
00452       for(int iframe=0; iframe <(int)localMsgCopy.numFrames; ++iframe)
00453       {
00454          toolbox::mem::Reference *thisref=next;
00455          next = thisref->getNextReference();
00456          thisref->setNextReference(0);
00457          I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME          *thisstdMsg = (I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME*)thisref->getDataLocation();
00458          I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME *thismsg = (I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME*)thisstdMsg;
00459 
00460          // 04-Nov-2008, need to make a local copy of I2O header information.
00461          // Do *NOT* use the dataPtr() method of the thisMsgCopy because this
00462          // copy operation doesn't include the data, only the header!
00463          I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME thisMsgCopy;
00464          from = static_cast<const char*>(thisref->getDataLocation());
00465          msize = sizeof(I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME);
00466          dest = (char*) &thisMsgCopy;
00467          std::copy(from, from+msize, dest);
00468          thisMsgCopy.dataSize = msize;
00469 
00470          EventBuffer::ProducerBuffer b(jc_->getFragmentQueue());
00471          int thislen = thismsg->dataSize;
00472          // ***  must give it the 1 of N for this fragment (starts from 0 in i2o header)
00473          new (b.buffer()) stor::FragEntry(thisref, (char*)(thismsg->dataPtr()), thislen,
00474                                           thismsg->frameCount+1, thismsg->numFrames, Header::INIT, 
00475                                           0, thismsg->hltTid, thismsg->outModID,
00476                                           thismsg->fuProcID, thismsg->fuGUID);
00477          std::copy(thismsg->hltURL, thismsg->hltURL+MAX_I2O_SM_URLCHARS,
00478                    static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltURL_);
00479          std::copy(thismsg->hltClassName, thismsg->hltClassName+MAX_I2O_SM_URLCHARS,
00480                    static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltClassName_);
00481          static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltLocalId_ = thismsg->hltLocalId;
00482          static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltInstance_ = thismsg->hltInstance;
00483          static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltTid_ = thismsg->hltTid;
00484          static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->rbBufferID_ = thismsg->rbBufferID;
00485          b.commit(sizeof(stor::FragEntry));
00486 
00487          ++receivedFrames_;
00488          // for bandwidth performance measurements
00489          // Following is wrong for the last frame because frame sent is
00490          // is actually larger than the size taken by actual data
00491          unsigned long actualFrameSize = (unsigned long)sizeof(I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME)
00492                                          +thislen;
00493          addMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
00494 
00495          // add this output module to the monitoring
00496          bool alreadyStoredOutMod = false;
00497          uint32 moduleId = thisMsgCopy.outModID;
00498          std::string dmoduleLabel("ID_" + boost::lexical_cast<std::string>(thisMsgCopy.outModID));
00499          if(modId2ModOutMap_.find(moduleId) != modId2ModOutMap_.end()) alreadyStoredOutMod = true;
00500          if(!alreadyStoredOutMod) {
00501            modId2ModOutMap_.insert(std::make_pair(moduleId,dmoduleLabel));
00502            receivedEventsMap_.insert(std::make_pair(dmoduleLabel,0));
00503            avEventSizeMap_.insert(std::make_pair(dmoduleLabel,
00504                    boost::shared_ptr<ForeverAverageCounter>(new ForeverAverageCounter()) ));
00505            avCompressRatioMap_.insert(std::make_pair(dmoduleLabel,
00506                    boost::shared_ptr<ForeverAverageCounter>(new ForeverAverageCounter()) ));
00507          }
00508       }
00509 
00510     } else {
00511       // should never get here!
00512       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: INIT Head frame has fewer linked frames "
00513                  << "than expected: abnormal error! " << std::endl;
00514       LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),"INIT Head frame has fewer linked frames" 
00515                       << " than expected: abnormal error! ");
00516     }
00517   }
00518 
00519   if (is_local_chain == 0) 
00520   {
00521     // put pointers into fragment collector queue
00522     EventBuffer::ProducerBuffer b(jc_->getFragmentQueue());
00523     // must give it the 1 of N for this fragment (starts from 0 in i2o header)
00524     new (b.buffer()) stor::FragEntry(ref, (char*)(msg->dataPtr()), len,
00525                                      msg->frameCount+1, msg->numFrames, Header::INIT,
00526                                      0, msg->hltTid, msg->outModID,
00527                                      msg->fuProcID, msg->fuGUID);
00528     std::copy(msg->hltURL, msg->hltURL+MAX_I2O_SM_URLCHARS,
00529               static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltURL_);
00530     std::copy(msg->hltClassName, msg->hltClassName+MAX_I2O_SM_URLCHARS,
00531               static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltClassName_);
00532     static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltLocalId_ = msg->hltLocalId;
00533     static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltInstance_ = msg->hltInstance;
00534     static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->hltTid_ = msg->hltTid;
00535     static_cast<stor::FragEntry*>(b.buffer())->rbBufferID_ = msg->rbBufferID;
00536     b.commit(sizeof(stor::FragEntry));
00537     // Frame release is done in the deleter.
00538     ++receivedFrames_;
00539     // for bandwidth performance measurements
00540     unsigned long actualFrameSize = (unsigned long)sizeof(I2O_SM_PREAMBLE_MESSAGE_FRAME)
00541                                     + len;
00542     addMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
00543 
00544     // add this output module to the monitoring
00545     bool alreadyStoredOutMod = false;
00546     uint32 moduleId = localMsgCopy.outModID;
00547     std::string dmoduleLabel("ID_" + boost::lexical_cast<std::string>(localMsgCopy.outModID));
00548     if(modId2ModOutMap_.find(moduleId) != modId2ModOutMap_.end()) alreadyStoredOutMod = true;
00549     if(!alreadyStoredOutMod) {
00550       modId2ModOutMap_.insert(std::make_pair(moduleId,dmoduleLabel));
00551       receivedEventsMap_.insert(std::make_pair(dmoduleLabel,0));
00552       avEventSizeMap_.insert(std::make_pair(dmoduleLabel,
00553           boost::shared_ptr<ForeverAverageCounter>(new ForeverAverageCounter()) ));
00554       avCompressRatioMap_.insert(std::make_pair(dmoduleLabel,
00555           boost::shared_ptr<ForeverAverageCounter>(new ForeverAverageCounter()) ));
00556     }
00557   }
00558 
00559   if (  localMsgCopy.frameCount == localMsgCopy.numFrames-1 )
00560   {
00561     string hltClassName(localMsgCopy.hltClassName);
00562     sendDiscardMessage(localMsgCopy.rbBufferID, 
00563                        localMsgCopy.hltInstance, 
00564                        I2O_FU_DATA_DISCARD,
00565                        hltClassName);
00566   }
00567 }
00568 
00569 void StorageManager::receiveDataMessage(toolbox::mem::Reference *ref)
00570 {
00571   // get the memory pool pointer for statistics if not already set
00572   if(pool_is_set_ == 0)
00573   {
00574     pool_ = ref->getBuffer()->getPool();
00575     pool_is_set_ = 1;
00576   }
00577 
00578   I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME         *stdMsg =
00579     (I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME*)ref->getDataLocation();
00580   I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME *msg    =
00581     (I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME*)stdMsg;
00582   FDEBUG(10)   << "StorageManager: Received data message from HLT at " << msg->hltURL 
00583          << " application " << msg->hltClassName << " id " << msg->hltLocalId
00584          << " instance " << msg->hltInstance << " tid " << msg->hltTid
00585          << " rbBufferID " << msg->rbBufferID << " outModID " << msg->outModID
00586                << " fuProcID " << msg->fuProcID  << " fuGUID 0x" << std::hex
00587                << msg->fuGUID << std::dec << std::endl;
00588   FDEBUG(10)   << "                 for run " << msg->runID << " event " << msg->eventID
00589          << " total frames = " << msg->numFrames << std::endl;
00590   FDEBUG(10)   << "StorageManager: Frame " << msg->frameCount << " of " 
00591          << msg->numFrames-1 << std::endl;
00592   
00593   int len = msg->dataSize;
00594 
00595   // check the storage Manager is in the Ready state first!
00596   if(fsm_.stateName()->toString() != "Enabled")
00597   {
00598     LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),
00599                        "Received EVENT message but not in Enabled state! Current state = "
00600                        << fsm_.stateName()->toString() << " EVENT from" << msg->hltURL
00601                        << " application " << msg->hltClassName);
00602     // just release the memory at least - is that what we want to do?
00603     ref->release();
00604     return;
00605   }
00606 
00607   // 04-Nov-2008, HWKC and KAB - make local copy of I2O message header so
00608   // that we can use that information even after the Reference is released.
00609   // Do *NOT* use the dataPtr() method of the localMsgCopy because this
00610   // copy operation doesn't include the data, only the header!
00611   I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME localMsgCopy;
00612   const char* from = static_cast<const char*>(ref->getDataLocation());
00613   unsigned int msize = sizeof(I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME);
00614   char* dest = (char*) &localMsgCopy;
00615   std::copy(from, from+msize, dest);
00616   localMsgCopy.dataSize = msize;
00617 
00618   // If running with local transfers, a chain of I2O frames when posted only has the
00619   // head frame sent. So a single frame can complete a chain for local transfers.
00620   // We need to test for this. Must be head frame, more than one frame
00621   // and next pointer must exist.
00622   int is_local_chain = 0;
00623   if(msg->frameCount == 0 && msg->numFrames > 1 && ref->getNextReference())
00624   {
00625     // this looks like a chain of frames (local transfer)
00626     toolbox::mem::Reference *head = ref;
00627     toolbox::mem::Reference *next = 0;
00628     // best to check the complete chain just in case!
00629     unsigned int tested_frames = 1;
00630     next = head;
00631     while((next=next->getNextReference())!=0) ++tested_frames;
00632     FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Head frame has " << tested_frames-1
00633                << " linked frames out of " << msg->numFrames-1 << std::endl;
00634     if(msg->numFrames == tested_frames)
00635     {
00636       // found a complete linked chain from the leading frame
00637       is_local_chain = 1;
00638       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Leading frame contains a complete linked chain"
00639                  << " - must be local transfer" << std::endl;
00640       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Breaking the chain" << std::endl;
00641       // break the chain and feed them to the fragment collector
00642       next = head;
00643 
00644       for(int iframe=0; iframe <(int)localMsgCopy.numFrames; ++iframe)
00645       {
00646          toolbox::mem::Reference *thisref=next;
00647          next = thisref->getNextReference();
00648          thisref->setNextReference(0);
00649          I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME         *thisstdMsg = (I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME*)thisref->getDataLocation();
00650          I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME *thismsg    = (I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME*)thisstdMsg;
00651 
00652          // 04-Nov-2008, need to make a local copy of I2O header information.
00653          // Do *NOT* use the dataPtr() method of the thisMsgCopy because this
00654          // copy operation doesn't include the data, only the header!
00655          I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME thisMsgCopy;
00656          from = static_cast<const char*>(thisref->getDataLocation());
00657          msize = sizeof(I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME);
00658          dest = (char*) &thisMsgCopy;
00659          std::copy(from, from+msize, dest);
00660          thisMsgCopy.dataSize = msize;
00661 
00662          EventBuffer::ProducerBuffer b(jc_->getFragmentQueue());
00663          int thislen = thismsg->dataSize;
00664          // ***  must give it the 1 of N for this fragment (starts from 0 in i2o header)
00665          new (b.buffer()) stor::FragEntry(thisref, (char*)(thismsg->dataPtr()), thislen,
00666                                           thismsg->frameCount+1, thismsg->numFrames, Header::EVENT, 
00667                                           thismsg->runID, thismsg->eventID, thismsg->outModID,
00668                                           thismsg->fuProcID, thismsg->fuGUID);
00669          b.commit(sizeof(stor::FragEntry));
00670 
00671          ++receivedFrames_;
00672          // for bandwidth performance measurements
00673          // Following is wrong for the last frame because frame sent is
00674          // is actually larger than the size taken by actual data
00675          unsigned long actualFrameSize = (unsigned long)sizeof(I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME)
00676                                          +thislen;
00677          addMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
00678 
00679          // should only do this test if the first data frame from each FU?
00680          // check if run number is the same as that in Run configuration, complain otherwise !!!
00681          // this->runNumber_ comes from the RunBase class that StorageManager inherits from
00682          if(thisMsgCopy.runID != runNumber_)
00683          {
00684            LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),"Run Number from event stream = " << thisMsgCopy.runID
00685                            << " From " << thisMsgCopy.hltURL
00686                            << " Different from Run Number from configuration = " << runNumber_);
00687          }
00688          // for data sender list update
00689          // thisMsgCopy.frameCount start from 0, but in EventMsg header it starts from 1!
00690          bool isLocal = true;
00691 
00692          //update last event seen
00693          lastEventSeen_ = thisMsgCopy.eventID;
00694 
00695          int status = 
00696      smrbsenders_.updateSender4data(&thisMsgCopy.hltURL[0], &thisMsgCopy.hltClassName[0],
00697             thisMsgCopy.hltLocalId, thisMsgCopy.hltInstance, thisMsgCopy.hltTid,
00698             thisMsgCopy.runID, thisMsgCopy.eventID, thisMsgCopy.frameCount+1, thisMsgCopy.numFrames,
00699             thisMsgCopy.originalSize, isLocal, thisMsgCopy.outModID);
00700 
00701          //if(status == 1) ++(storedEvents_.value_);
00702          if(status == 1) {
00703            ++(receivedEvents_.value_);
00704            uint32 moduleId = thisMsgCopy.outModID;
00705            if (modId2ModOutMap_.find(moduleId) != modId2ModOutMap_.end()) {
00706              std::string moduleLabel = modId2ModOutMap_[moduleId];
00707              ++(receivedEventsMap_[moduleLabel]);
00708              avEventSizeMap_[moduleLabel]->addSample((double)thisMsgCopy.originalSize);
00709              // TODO: get the uncompressed size to find compression ratio for stats
00710            }
00711            else {
00712              LOG4CPLUS_WARN(this->getApplicationLogger(),
00713                             "StorageManager::receiveDataMessage: "
00714                             << "Unable to find output module label when "
00715                             << "accumulating statistics for event "
00716                             << thisMsgCopy.eventID << ", output module "
00717                             << thisMsgCopy.outModID << ".");
00718            }
00719          }
00720 
00721          if(status == -1) {
00722            LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),
00723                     "updateSender4data: Cannot find RB in Data Sender list!"
00724                     << " With URL "
00725                     << thisMsgCopy.hltURL << " class " << thisMsgCopy.hltClassName  << " instance "
00726                     << thisMsgCopy.hltInstance << " Tid " << thisMsgCopy.hltTid);
00727          }
00728       }
00729 
00730     } else {
00731       // should never get here!
00732       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Head frame has fewer linked frames "
00733                  << "than expected: abnormal error! " << std::endl;
00734       LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),"Head frame has fewer linked frames" 
00735                       << " than expected: abnormal error! ");
00736     }
00737   }
00738 
00739   if (is_local_chain == 0) 
00740   {
00741     // put pointers into fragment collector queue
00742     EventBuffer::ProducerBuffer b(jc_->getFragmentQueue());
00743     // must give it the 1 of N for this fragment (starts from 0 in i2o header)
00744     new (b.buffer()) stor::FragEntry(ref, (char*)(msg->dataPtr()), len,
00745                                      msg->frameCount+1, msg->numFrames, Header::EVENT, 
00746                                      msg->runID, msg->eventID, msg->outModID,
00747                                      msg->fuProcID, msg->fuGUID);
00748     b.commit(sizeof(stor::FragEntry));
00749     // Frame release is done in the deleter.
00750     ++receivedFrames_;
00751     // for bandwidth performance measurements
00752     unsigned long actualFrameSize = (unsigned long)sizeof(I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME)
00753                                     + len;
00754     addMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
00755 
00756     // should only do this test if the first data frame from each FU?
00757     // check if run number is the same as that in Run configuration, complain otherwise !!!
00758     // this->runNumber_ comes from the RunBase class that StorageManager inherits from
00759     if(localMsgCopy.runID != runNumber_)
00760     {
00761       LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),"Run Number from event stream = "
00762           << localMsgCopy.runID << " From " << localMsgCopy.hltURL
00763                       << " Different from Run Number from configuration = " << runNumber_);
00764     }
00765 
00766     //update last event seen
00767     lastEventSeen_ = localMsgCopy.eventID;
00768 
00769     // for data sender list update
00770     // localMsgCopy.frameCount start from 0, but in EventMsg header it starts from 1!
00771     bool isLocal = false;
00772     int status = 
00773       smrbsenders_.updateSender4data(&localMsgCopy.hltURL[0], &localMsgCopy.hltClassName[0],
00774                                      localMsgCopy.hltLocalId, localMsgCopy.hltInstance, localMsgCopy.hltTid,
00775                                      localMsgCopy.runID, localMsgCopy.eventID, localMsgCopy.frameCount+1, localMsgCopy.numFrames,
00776                                      localMsgCopy.originalSize, isLocal, localMsgCopy.outModID);
00777 
00778     //if(status == 1) ++(storedEvents_.value_);
00779     if(status == 1) {
00780       ++(receivedEvents_.value_);
00781       uint32 moduleId = localMsgCopy.outModID;
00782       if (modId2ModOutMap_.find(moduleId) != modId2ModOutMap_.end()) {
00783         std::string moduleLabel = modId2ModOutMap_[moduleId];
00784         ++(receivedEventsMap_[moduleLabel]);
00785         avEventSizeMap_[moduleLabel]->addSample((double)localMsgCopy.originalSize);
00786         // TODO: get the uncompressed size to find compression ratio for stats
00787       }
00788       else {
00789         LOG4CPLUS_WARN(this->getApplicationLogger(),
00790                        "StorageManager::receiveDataMessage: "
00791                        << "Unable to find output module label when "
00792                        << "accumulating statistics for event "
00793                        << localMsgCopy.eventID << ", output module "
00794                        << localMsgCopy.outModID << ".");
00795       }
00796     }
00797     if(status == -1) {
00798       LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),
00799           "updateSender4data: Cannot find RB in Data Sender list!"
00800           << " With URL "
00801           << localMsgCopy.hltURL << " class " << localMsgCopy.hltClassName  << " instance "
00802           << localMsgCopy.hltInstance << " Tid " << localMsgCopy.hltTid);
00803     }
00804   }
00805 
00806   if (  localMsgCopy.frameCount == localMsgCopy.numFrames-1 )
00807     {
00808       string hltClassName(localMsgCopy.hltClassName);
00809       sendDiscardMessage(localMsgCopy.rbBufferID, 
00810        localMsgCopy.hltInstance, 
00811        I2O_FU_DATA_DISCARD,
00812        hltClassName);
00813     }
00814 }
00815 
00816 void StorageManager::receiveErrorDataMessage(toolbox::mem::Reference *ref)
00817 {
00818   // get the memory pool pointer for statistics if not already set
00819   if(pool_is_set_ == 0)
00820   {
00821     pool_ = ref->getBuffer()->getPool();
00822     pool_is_set_ = 1;
00823   }
00824 
00825   I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME         *stdMsg =
00826     (I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME*)ref->getDataLocation();
00827   I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME *msg    =
00828     (I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME*)stdMsg;
00829   FDEBUG(10)   << "StorageManager: Received error data message from HLT at " << msg->hltURL 
00830          << " application " << msg->hltClassName << " id " << msg->hltLocalId
00831          << " instance " << msg->hltInstance << " tid " << msg->hltTid
00832                << " rbBufferID " << msg->rbBufferID << " outModID " << msg->outModID
00833                << " fuProcID " << msg->fuProcID  << " fuGUID 0x" << std::hex
00834                << msg->fuGUID << std::dec << std::endl;
00835   FDEBUG(10)   << "                 for run " << msg->runID << " event " << msg->eventID
00836          << " total frames = " << msg->numFrames << std::endl;
00837   FDEBUG(10)   << "StorageManager: Frame " << msg->frameCount << " of " 
00838          << msg->numFrames-1 << std::endl;
00839   
00840   int len = msg->dataSize;
00841 
00842   // check the storage Manager is in the Ready state first!
00843   if(fsm_.stateName()->toString() != "Enabled")
00844   {
00845     LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),
00846                        "Received ERROR message but not in Enabled state! Current state = "
00847                        << fsm_.stateName()->toString() << " ERROR from" << msg->hltURL
00848                        << " application " << msg->hltClassName);
00849     // just release the memory at least - is that what we want to do?
00850     ref->release();
00851     return;
00852   }
00853 
00854   // 04-Nov-2008, HWKC and KAB - make local copy of I2O message header so
00855   // that we can use that information even after the Reference is released.
00856   // Do *NOT* use the dataPtr() method of the localMsgCopy because this
00857   // copy operation doesn't include the data, only the header!
00858   I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME localMsgCopy;
00859   const char* from = static_cast<const char*>(ref->getDataLocation());
00860   unsigned int msize = sizeof(I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME);
00861   char* dest = (char*) &localMsgCopy;
00862   std::copy(from, from+msize, dest);
00863   localMsgCopy.dataSize = msize;
00864

00866   // head frame sent. So a single frame can complete a chain for local transfers.
00867   // We need to test for this. Must be head frame, more than one frame
00868   // and next pointer must exist.
00869   int is_local_chain = 0;
00870   if(msg->frameCount == 0 && msg->numFrames > 1 && ref->getNextReference())
00871   {
00872     // this looks like a chain of frames (local transfer)
00873     toolbox::mem::Reference *head = ref;
00874     toolbox::mem::Reference *next = 0;
00875     // best to check the complete chain just in case!
00876     unsigned int tested_frames = 1;
00877     next = head;
00878     while((next=next->getNextReference())!=0) ++tested_frames;
00879     FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Head frame has " << tested_frames-1
00880                << " linked frames out of " << msg->numFrames-1 << std::endl;
00881     if(msg->numFrames == tested_frames)
00882     {
00883       // found a complete linked chain from the leading frame
00884       is_local_chain = 1;
00885       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Leading frame contains a complete linked chain"
00886                  << " - must be local transfer" << std::endl;
00887       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Breaking the chain" << std::endl;
00888       // break the chain and feed them to the fragment collector
00889       next = head;
00890 
00891       for(int iframe=0; iframe <(int)localMsgCopy.numFrames; ++iframe)
00892       {
00893          toolbox::mem::Reference *thisref=next;
00894          next = thisref->getNextReference();
00895          thisref->setNextReference(0);
00896          I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME         *thisstdMsg = (I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME*)thisref->getDataLocation();
00897          I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME *thismsg    = (I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME*)thisstdMsg;
00898 
00899          // 04-Nov-2008, need to make a local copy of I2O header information.
00900          // Do *NOT* use the dataPtr() method of the thisMsgCopy because this
00901          // copy operation doesn't include the data, only the header!
00902          I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME thisMsgCopy;
00903          from = static_cast<const char*>(thisref->getDataLocation());
00904          msize = sizeof(I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME);
00905          dest = (char*) &thisMsgCopy;
00906          std::copy(from, from+msize, dest);
00907          thisMsgCopy.dataSize = msize;
00908 
00909          EventBuffer::ProducerBuffer b(jc_->getFragmentQueue());
00910          int thislen = thismsg->dataSize;
00911          // ***  must give it the 1 of N for this fragment (starts from 0 in i2o header)
00912          new (b.buffer()) stor::FragEntry(thisref, (char*)(thismsg->dataPtr()), thislen,
00913                                           thismsg->frameCount+1, thismsg->numFrames, Header::ERROR_EVENT, 
00914                                           thismsg->runID, thismsg->eventID, thismsg->outModID,
00915                                           thismsg->fuProcID, thismsg->fuGUID);
00916          b.commit(sizeof(stor::FragEntry));
00917 
00918          ++receivedFrames_;
00919          // for bandwidth performance measurements
00920          // Following is wrong for the last frame because frame sent is
00921          // is actually larger than the size taken by actual data
00922          unsigned long actualFrameSize = (unsigned long)sizeof(I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME)
00923                                          +thislen;
00924          addMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
00925 
00926          // should only do this test if the first data frame from each FU?
00927          // check if run number is the same as that in Run configuration, complain otherwise !!!
00928          // this->runNumber_ comes from the RunBase class that StorageManager inherits from
00929          if(thisMsgCopy.runID != runNumber_)
00930          {
00931            LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),"Run Number from error event stream = "
00932          << thisMsgCopy.runID << " From " << thisMsgCopy.hltURL
00933                            << " Different from Run Number from configuration = " << runNumber_);
00934          }
00935          // for data sender list update
00936          // thisMsgCopy.frameCount start from 0, but in EventMsg header it starts from 1!
00937          //bool isLocal = true;
00938 
00939          //update last error event seen
00940          lastErrorEventSeen_ = thisMsgCopy.eventID;
00941 
00942          // TODO need to fix this as the outModId is not valid for error events
00943          /*
00944          int status = 
00945      smrbsenders_.updateSender4data(&thisMsgCopy.hltURL[0], &thisMsgCopy.hltClassName[0],
00946      thisMsgCopy.hltLocalId, thisMsgCopy.hltInstance, thisMsgCopy.hltTid,
00947      thisMsgCopy.runID, thisMsgCopy.eventID, thisMsgCopy.frameCount+1, thisMsgCopy.numFrames,
00948      thisMsgCopy.originalSize, isLocal, thisMsgCopy.outModID);
00949          */
00950 
00951          // 13-Aug-2008, KAB - for now, increment the receivedErrorEvent counter
00952          // independent of the result of the updateFUSender4data() call since we
00953          // know that the result is unlikely to be "success"
00954          //if(status == 1) {
00955            ++(receivedErrorEvents_.value_);
00956          //}
00957 
00958          /*
00959          if(status == -1) {
00960            LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),
00961                     "updateSender4data: Cannot find RB in Data Sender list!"
00962                     << " For Error Event With URL "
00963                     << thisMsgCopy.hltURL << " class " << thisMsgCopy.hltClassName  << " instance "
00964                     << thisMsgCopy.hltInstance << " Tid " << thisMsgCopy.hltTid);
00965          }
00966          */
00967       }
00968 
00969     } else {
00970       // should never get here!
00971       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Head frame has fewer linked frames "
00972                  << "than expected: abnormal error! " << std::endl;
00973     }
00974   }
00975 
00976   if (is_local_chain == 0) 
00977   {
00978     // put pointers into fragment collector queue
00979     EventBuffer::ProducerBuffer b(jc_->getFragmentQueue());
00980     // must give it the 1 of N for this fragment (starts from 0 in i2o header)
00981     new (b.buffer()) stor::FragEntry(ref, (char*)(msg->dataPtr()), len,
00982                                      msg->frameCount+1, msg->numFrames, Header::ERROR_EVENT, 
00983                                      msg->runID, msg->eventID, msg->outModID,
00984                                      msg->fuProcID, msg->fuGUID);
00985     b.commit(sizeof(stor::FragEntry));
00986     // Frame release is done in the deleter.
00987     ++receivedFrames_;
00988     // for bandwidth performance measurements
00989     unsigned long actualFrameSize = (unsigned long)sizeof(I2O_SM_DATA_MESSAGE_FRAME)
00990                                     + len;
00991     addMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
00992 
00993     // should only do this test if the first data frame from each FU?
00994     // check if run number is the same as that in Run configuration, complain otherwise !!!
00995     // this->runNumber_ comes from the RunBase class that StorageManager inherits from
00996     if(localMsgCopy.runID != runNumber_)
00997     {
00998       LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),"Run Number from error event stream = "
00999           << localMsgCopy.runID << " From " << localMsgCopy.hltURL
01000                       << " Different from Run Number from configuration = " << runNumber_);
01001     }
01002 
01003     //update last error event seen
01004     lastErrorEventSeen_ = localMsgCopy.eventID;
01005 
01006     // for data sender list update
01007     // localMsgCopy.frameCount start from 0, but in EventMsg header it starts from 1!
01008     //bool isLocal = false;
01009     // TODO need to fix this as the outModId is not valid for error events
01010     /*
01011     int status = 
01012       smrbsenders_.updateSender4data(&localMsgCopy.hltURL[0], &localMsgCopy.hltClassName[0],
01013       localMsgCopy.hltLocalId, localMsgCopy.hltInstance, localMsgCopy.hltTid,
01014       localMsgCopy.runID, localMsgCopy.eventID, localMsgCopy.frameCount+1, localMsgCopy.numFrames,
01015       localMsgCopy.originalSize, isLocal, localMsgCopy.outModID);
01016     */
01017     
01018     // 13-Aug-2008, KAB - for now, increment the receivedErrorEvent counter
01019     // independent of the result of the updateFUSender4data() call since we
01020     // know that the result is unlikely to be "success"
01021     //if(status == 1) {
01022       ++(receivedErrorEvents_.value_);
01023     //}
01024     /*
01025     if(status == -1) {
01026       LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),
01027           "updateSender4data: Cannot find RB in Data Sender list!"
01028           << " For Error Event With URL "
01029           << localMsgCopy.hltURL << " class " << localMsgCopy.hltClassName  << " instance "
01030           << localMsgCopy.hltInstance << " Tid " << localMsgCopy.hltTid);
01031     }
01032     */
01033   }
01034 
01035   if (  localMsgCopy.frameCount == localMsgCopy.numFrames-1 )
01036     {
01037       string hltClassName(localMsgCopy.hltClassName);
01038       sendDiscardMessage(localMsgCopy.rbBufferID, 
01039        localMsgCopy.hltInstance, 
01040        I2O_FU_DATA_DISCARD,
01041        hltClassName);
01042     }
01043 }
01044 
01045 void StorageManager::receiveDQMMessage(toolbox::mem::Reference *ref)
01046 {
01047   // get the memory pool pointer for statistics if not already set
01048   if(pool_is_set_ == 0)
01049   {
01050     pool_ = ref->getBuffer()->getPool();
01051     pool_is_set_ = 1;
01052   }
01053 
01054   I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME         *stdMsg =
01055     (I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME*)ref->getDataLocation();
01056   I2O_SM_DQM_MESSAGE_FRAME *msg    =
01057     (I2O_SM_DQM_MESSAGE_FRAME*)stdMsg;
01058   FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Received DQM message from HLT at " << msg->hltURL 
01059              << " application " << msg->hltClassName << " id " << msg->hltLocalId
01060              << " instance " << msg->hltInstance << " tid " << msg->hltTid
01061              << " rbBufferID " << msg->rbBufferID << " folderID " << msg->folderID
01062              << " fuProcID " << msg->fuProcID  << " fuGUID 0x" << std::hex
01063             << msg->fuGUID << std::dec << std::endl;
01064   FDEBUG(10) << "                 for run " << msg->runID << " eventATUpdate = " << msg->eventAtUpdateID
01065              << " total frames = " << msg->numFrames << std::endl;
01066   FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Frame " << msg->frameCount << " of " 
01067              << msg->numFrames-1 << std::endl;
01068   int len = msg->dataSize;
01069   FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: received DQM frame size = " << len << std::endl;
01070 
01071   // check the storage Manager is in the Ready state first!
01072   if(fsm_.stateName()->toString() != "Enabled")
01073   {
01074     LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),
01075                        "Received DQM message but not in Enabled state! Current state = "
01076                        << fsm_.stateName()->toString() << " DQMMessage from" << msg->hltURL
01077                        << " application " << msg->hltClassName);
01078     // just release the memory at least - is that what we want to do?
01079     ref->release();
01080     return;
01081   }
01082   ++(dqmRecords_.value_);
01083 
01084   // 04-Nov-2008, HWKC and KAB - make local copy of I2O message header so
01085   // that we can use that information even after the Reference is released.
01086   // Do *NOT* use the dataPtr() method of the localMsgCopy because this
01087   // copy operation doesn't include the data, only the header!
01088   I2O_SM_DQM_MESSAGE_FRAME localMsgCopy;
01089   const char* from = static_cast<const char*>(ref->getDataLocation());
01090   unsigned int msize = sizeof(I2O_SM_DQM_MESSAGE_FRAME);
01091   char* dest = (char*) &localMsgCopy;
01092   std::copy(from, from+msize, dest);
01093   localMsgCopy.dataSize = msize;
01094 
01095   // If running with local transfers, a chain of I2O frames when posted only has the
01096   // head frame sent. So a single frame can complete a chain for local transfers.
01097   // We need to test for this. Must be head frame, more than one frame
01098   // and next pointer must exist.
01099   // -- we have to break chains due to the way the FragmentCollector frees memory
01100   //    for each frame after processing each as the freeing a chain frees all memory
01101   //    in the chain
01102   int is_local_chain = 0;
01103   if(msg->frameCount == 0 && msg->numFrames > 1 && ref->getNextReference())
01104   {
01105     // this looks like a chain of frames (local transfer)
01106     toolbox::mem::Reference *head = ref;
01107     toolbox::mem::Reference *next = 0;
01108     // best to check the complete chain just in case!
01109     unsigned int tested_frames = 1;
01110     next = head;
01111     while((next=next->getNextReference())!=0) ++tested_frames;
01112     FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: DQM Head frame has " << tested_frames-1
01113                << " linked frames out of " << msg->numFrames-1 << std::endl;
01114     if(msg->numFrames == tested_frames)
01115     {
01116       // found a complete linked chain from the leading frame
01117       is_local_chain = 1;
01118       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Leading frame contains a complete linked chain"
01119                  << " - must be local transfer" << std::endl;
01120       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: Breaking the chain" << std::endl;
01121       // break the chain and feed them to the fragment collector
01122       next = head;
01123 
01124       for(int iframe=0; iframe <(int)localMsgCopy.numFrames; ++iframe)
01125       {
01126          toolbox::mem::Reference *thisref=next;
01127          next = thisref->getNextReference();
01128          thisref->setNextReference(0);
01129          I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME         *thisstdMsg = (I2O_MESSAGE_FRAME*)thisref->getDataLocation();
01130          I2O_SM_DQM_MESSAGE_FRAME *thismsg    = (I2O_SM_DQM_MESSAGE_FRAME*)thisstdMsg;
01131          EventBuffer::ProducerBuffer b(jc_->getFragmentQueue());
01132          int thislen = thismsg->dataSize;
01133          // ***  must give it the 1 of N for this fragment (starts from 0 in i2o header)
01134          new (b.buffer()) stor::FragEntry(thisref, (char*)(thismsg->dataPtr()), thislen,
01135                                           thismsg->frameCount+1, thismsg->numFrames, Header::DQM_EVENT, 
01136                                           thismsg->runID, thismsg->eventAtUpdateID, thismsg->folderID,
01137                                           thismsg->fuProcID, thismsg->fuGUID);
01138          b.commit(sizeof(stor::FragEntry));
01139 
01140          // BE CAREFUL not to use thismsg after this point because it
01141          // may have been released already by the FragmentCollector!
01142          // If it needs to be used, make a copy.
01143 
01144          ++receivedFrames_;
01145          // for bandwidth performance measurements
01146          // Following is wrong for the last frame because frame sent is
01147          // is actually larger than the size taken by actual data
01148          unsigned long actualFrameSize = (unsigned long)sizeof(I2O_SM_DQM_MESSAGE_FRAME)
01149                                          +thislen;
01150          addMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
01151          addDQMMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
01152 
01153          // no data sender list update yet for DQM data, should add it here
01154       }
01155 
01156     } else {
01157       // should never get here!
01158       FDEBUG(10) << "StorageManager: DQM Head frame has fewer linked frames "
01159                  << "than expected: abnormal error! " << std::endl;
01160       LOG4CPLUS_ERROR(this->getApplicationLogger(),"DQM Head frame has fewer linked frames" 
01161                       << " than expected: abnormal error! ");
01162     }
01163   }
01164 
01165   if (is_local_chain == 0) 
01166   {
01167     // put pointers into fragment collector queue
01168     EventBuffer::ProducerBuffer b(jc_->getFragmentQueue());
01169     // must give it the 1 of N for this fragment (starts from 0 in i2o header)
01170     new (b.buffer()) stor::FragEntry(ref, (char*)(msg->dataPtr()), len,
01171                                      msg->frameCount+1, msg->numFrames, Header::DQM_EVENT, 
01172                                      msg->runID, msg->eventAtUpdateID, msg->folderID,
01173                                      msg->fuProcID, msg->fuGUID);
01174     b.commit(sizeof(stor::FragEntry));
01175     // Frame release is done in the deleter.
01176     ++receivedFrames_;
01177     // for bandwidth performance measurements
01178     unsigned long actualFrameSize = (unsigned long)sizeof(I2O_SM_DQM_MESSAGE_FRAME)
01179                                     + len;
01180     addMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
01181     addDQMMeasurement(actualFrameSize);
01182 
01183     // no data sender list update yet for DQM data, should add it here
01184   }
01185 
01186   if (  localMsgCopy.frameCount == localMsgCopy.numFrames-1 )
01187     {
01188       string hltClassName(localMsgCopy.hltClassName);
01189       sendDiscardMessage(localMsgCopy.rbBufferID, 
01190        localMsgCopy.hltInstance, 
01191        I2O_FU_DQM_DISCARD,
01192        hltClassName);
01193     }
01194 }
01195 
01197 void StorageManager::addMeasurement(unsigned long size)
01198 {
01199   // for bandwidth performance measurements, first sample based
01200   if ( pmeter_->addSample(size) )
01201   {
01202     // Copy measurements for our record
01203     stor::SMPerfStats stats = pmeter_->getStats();
01204 
01205     instantBandwidth_= stats.shortTermCounter_->getValueRate();
01206     instantRate_     = stats.shortTermCounter_->getSampleRate();
01207     instantLatency_  = 1000000.0 / instantRate_;
01208 
01209     double now = ForeverCounter::getCurrentTime();
01210     totalSamples_    = stats.longTermCounter_->getSampleCount();
01211     duration_        = stats.longTermCounter_->getDuration(now);
01212     meanBandwidth_   = stats.longTermCounter_->getValueRate(now);
01213     meanRate_        = stats.longTermCounter_->getSampleRate(now);
01214     meanLatency_     = 1000000.0 / meanRate_;
01215 
01216     maxBandwidth_    = stats.maxBandwidth_;
01217     minBandwidth_    = stats.minBandwidth_;
01218   }
01219 
01220   // for time period bandwidth performance measurements
01221   if ( pmeter_->getStats().shortPeriodCounter_->hasValidResult() )
01222   {
01223     // Copy measurements for our record
01224     stor::SMPerfStats stats = pmeter_->getStats();
01225 
01226     instantBandwidth2_= stats.shortPeriodCounter_->getValueRate();
01227     instantRate2_     = stats.shortPeriodCounter_->getSampleRate();
01228     instantLatency2_  = 1000000.0 / instantRate2_;
01229 
01230     double now = ForeverCounter::getCurrentTime();
01231     totalSamples2_    = stats.longTermCounter_->getSampleCount();
01232     duration2_        = stats.longTermCounter_->getDuration(now);
01233     meanBandwidth2_   = stats.longTermCounter_->getValueRate(now);
01234     meanRate2_        = stats.longTermCounter_->getSampleRate(now);
01235     meanLatency2_     = 1000000.0 / meanRate2_;
01236 
01237     maxBandwidth2_    = stats.maxBandwidth2_;
01238     minBandwidth2_    = stats.minBandwidth2_;
01239   }
01240   receivedVolume_ = pmeter_->totalvolumemb();
01241 
01242   // TODO fixme: Find a better place to put this testing of the Fragment Collector thread status!
01243   // leave this for now until we have the transition available and have clean up code
01244   if(stor::getSMFC_exceptionStatus()) {
01245     // there was a fatal exception in the Fragmentation Collector and
01246     // we want to go to a fail state
01247     //reasonForFailedState_  = stor::getSMFC_reason4Exception();
01248     //fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
01249     edm::LogError("StorageManager") << "Fatal problem in FragmentCollector thread detected! \n"
01250        << stor::getSMFC_reason4Exception();
01251     //@@EM added state transition to failed
01252     reasonForFailedState_ = stor::getSMFC_reason4Exception();
01253     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
01254 
01255   }
01256 }
01257 
01258 void StorageManager::addDQMMeasurement(unsigned long size)
01259 {
01260   // for bandwidth performance measurements, first sample based
01261   if ( DQMpmeter_->addSample(size) )
01262   {
01263     // Copy measurements for our record
01264     stor::SMPerfStats stats = DQMpmeter_->getStats();
01265 
01266     DQMinstantBandwidth_= stats.shortTermCounter_->getValueRate();
01267     DQMinstantRate_     = stats.shortTermCounter_->getSampleRate();
01268     DQMinstantLatency_  = 1000000.0 / DQMinstantRate_;
01269 
01270     double now = ForeverCounter::getCurrentTime();
01271     DQMtotalSamples_    = stats.longTermCounter_->getSampleCount();
01272     DQMduration_        = stats.longTermCounter_->getDuration(now);
01273     DQMmeanBandwidth_   = stats.longTermCounter_->getValueRate(now);
01274     DQMmeanRate_        = stats.longTermCounter_->getSampleRate(now);
01275     DQMmeanLatency_     = 1000000.0 / DQMmeanRate_;
01276 
01277     DQMmaxBandwidth_    = stats.maxBandwidth_;
01278     DQMminBandwidth_    = stats.minBandwidth_;
01279   }
01280 
01281   // for time period bandwidth performance measurements
01282   if ( DQMpmeter_->getStats().shortPeriodCounter_->hasValidResult() )
01283   {
01284     // Copy measurements for our record
01285     stor::SMPerfStats stats = DQMpmeter_->getStats();
01286 
01287     DQMinstantBandwidth2_= stats.shortPeriodCounter_->getValueRate();
01288     DQMinstantRate2_     = stats.shortPeriodCounter_->getSampleRate();
01289     DQMinstantLatency2_  = 1000000.0 / DQMinstantRate2_;
01290 
01291     double now = ForeverCounter::getCurrentTime();
01292     DQMtotalSamples2_    = stats.longTermCounter_->getSampleCount();
01293     DQMduration2_        = stats.longTermCounter_->getDuration(now);
01294     DQMmeanBandwidth2_   = stats.longTermCounter_->getValueRate(now);
01295     DQMmeanRate2_        = stats.longTermCounter_->getSampleRate(now);
01296     DQMmeanLatency2_     = 1000000.0 / DQMmeanRate2_;
01297 
01298     DQMmaxBandwidth2_    = stats.maxBandwidth2_;
01299     DQMminBandwidth2_    = stats.minBandwidth2_;
01300   }
01301   DQMreceivedVolume_ = DQMpmeter_->totalvolumemb();
01302 }

01426           *out << "<td align=center>" << endl;
01427           *out << "Max (KB)" << endl;
01428           *out << "</td>" << endl;

01439             outputModuleLabel = initMsgCollection->getOutputModuleName(oi->first);
01440           }
01441           *out << "<tr>" << endl;
01442             *out << "<td >" << endl;

01444             *out << "</td>" << endl;
01445             *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01446             //*out << receivedEventsMap_[oi->second] << endl;

01450             *out << avEventSizeMap_[oi->second]->getValueSum()/(double)0x100000 << endl;
01451             *out << "</td>" << endl;
01452             *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01453             *out << avEventSizeMap_[oi->second]->getValueAverage()/(double)0x400 << endl;
01454             *out << "</td>" << endl;
01455             *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01456             *out << avEventSizeMap_[oi->second]->getValueRMS()/(double)0x400 << endl;
01457             *out << "</td>" << endl;
01458             *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01459             *out << avEventSizeMap_[oi->second]->getValueMin()/(double)0x400 << endl;
01460             *out << "</td>" << endl;
01461             *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01462             *out << avEventSizeMap_[oi->second]->getValueMax()/(double)0x400 << endl;
01463             *out << "</td>" << endl;
01464           *out << "</tr>" << endl;
01465         }
01466         *out << "<tr><td bgcolor=\"#999933\" height=\"1\" colspan=\"7\"></td></tr>" << endl;
01467 
01468         *out << "<tr class=\"special\">" << endl;
01469           *out << "<td >" << endl;
01470           *out << "Events Stored (updated every 10s)" << endl;
01471           *out << "</td>" << endl;
01472           *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01473           *out << storedEvents_ << endl;
01474           *out << "</td>" << endl;
01475           *out << "<td colspan=5>" << endl;
01476           *out << "</td>" << endl;
01477         *out << "</tr>" << endl;
01478         xdata::Vector<xdata::String>::iterator ni(namesOfStream_.begin());
01479         xdata::Vector<xdata::UnsignedInteger32>::iterator si(storedEventsInStream_.begin()), 
01480           se(storedEventsInStream_.end());
01481         for( ; si != se; ++si) {
01482           *out << "<tr>" << endl;
01483             *out << "<td >" << endl;
01484             *out << "Events Stored for Stream " << ni->value_ << endl;
01485             *out << "</td>" << endl;
01486             *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01487             *out << si->value_ << endl;
01488             *out << "</td>" << endl;
01489             *out << "<td colspan=5>" << endl;
01490             *out << "</td>" << endl;
01491             ++ni;
01492           *out << "</tr>" << endl;
01493         }
01494         *out << "<tr><td bgcolor=\"#999933\" height=\"1\" colspan=\"7\"></td></tr>" << endl;
01495         *out << "<tr>" << endl;
01496           *out << "<td >" << endl;
01497           *out << "Last Event ID" << endl;
01498           *out << "</td>" << endl;
01499           *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01500           *out << lastEventSeen_ << endl;
01501           *out << "</td>" << endl;

01526         int nD = nLogicalDisk_;
01527         if (nD == 0) nD=1;
01528         for(int i=0;i<nD;++i) {
01529            string path(filePath_);
01530            if(nLogicalDisk_>0) {
01531               std::ostringstream oss;
01532               oss << "/" << setfill('0') << std::setw(2) << i; 
01533               path += oss.str();
01534            }
01535            struct statfs64 buf;
01536            int retVal = statfs64(path.c_str(), &buf);
01537            double btotal = 0;
01538            double bfree = 0;
01539            unsigned int used = 0;
01540            if(retVal==0) {
01541               unsigned int blksize = buf.f_bsize;
01542               btotal = buf.f_blocks * blksize / 1024 / 1024 /1024;
01543               bfree  = buf.f_bavail  * blksize / 1024 / 1024 /1024;
01544               used   = (int)(100 * (1. - bfree / btotal)); 
01545            }
01546         *out << "<tr>" << endl;
01547           *out << "<td >" << endl;
01548           *out << "Disk " << i << " usage " << endl;
01549           *out << "</td>" << endl;
01550           if(used>89)
01551              *out << "<td align=right bgcolor=\"#EF5A10\">" << endl;
01552           else 
01553              *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01554           *out << used << "% (" << btotal-bfree << " of " << btotal << " GB)" << endl;
01555           *out << "</td>" << endl;
01556           *out << "<td colspan=5>" << endl;
01557           *out << "</td>" << endl;
01558         *out << "</tr>" << endl;
01559         }
01560         *out << "<tr>" << endl;
01561           *out << "<td >" << endl;
01562           *out << "# CopyWorker" << endl;
01563           *out << "</td>" << endl;
01564           *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
01565           int ps1 = system("exit `ps ax | grep CopyWorker | grep perl | grep -v grep | wc -l`") / 256;
01566           *out << ps1 << endl;
01567           *out << "</td>" << endl;

01569           *out << "</td>" << endl;

02047     *out << "  </tr>"                                                  << endl;

02052     *out << "</th>" << endl;

02055     *out << "</th>" << endl;
02056     *out << "</tr>" << endl;

02059       *out << "SM CVS Version" << endl;
02060       *out << "</td>" << endl;
02061       *out << "<td>" << endl;

02063       *out << "</td>" << endl;

02066       *out << "<td colspan=2>" << endl;
02067       *out << "SM cfg string" << endl;
02068       *out << "</td>" << endl;
02069     *out << "  </tr>" << endl;

02073       *out << " readonly title=\"SM config\">"         << endl;
02074       *out << smConfigString_                                  << endl;
02075       *out << "</textarea>"                                          << endl;
02076       *out << " </td>"               << endl;
02077     *out << "</tr>"              << endl;

02082   *out << "</table>"                                                 << endl;

02084   *out << "<hr/>"                                                 << endl;
02085   std::string url = getApplicationDescriptor()->getContextDescriptor()->getURL();
02086   std::string urn = getApplicationDescriptor()->getURN();
02087   *out << "<a href=\"" << url << "/" << urn << "/rbsenderlist" << "\">" 
02088        << "RB Sender list web page" << "</a>" << endl;
02089   *out << "<hr/>"                                                 << endl;
02090   *out << "<a href=\"" << url << "/" << urn << "/streameroutput" << "\">" 
02091        << "Streamer Output Status web page" << "</a>" << endl;
02092   *out << "<hr/>"                                                 << endl;
02093   *out << "<a href=\"" << url << "/" << urn << "/EventServerStats?update=off"
02094        << "\">Event Server Statistics" << "</a>" << endl;
02095   /* --- leave these here to debug event server problems
02096   *out << "<a href=\"" << url << "/" << urn << "/geteventdata" << "\">" 
02097        << "Get an event via a web page" << "</a>" << endl;
02098   *out << "<hr/>"                                                 << endl;
02099   *out << "<a href=\"" << url << "/" << urn << "/getregdata" << "\">" 
02100        << "Get a header via a web page" << "</a>" << endl;
02101   */
02102 
02103   *out << "</body>"                                                  << endl;
02104   *out << "</html>"                                                  << endl;
02105 }

02109 void StorageManager::rbsenderWebPage(xgi::Input *in, xgi::Output *out)
02110   throw (xgi::exception::Exception)
02111 {
02112   *out << "<html>"                                                   << endl;

02118        << getApplicationDescriptor()->getInstance()
02119        << "</title>"     << endl;

02121     *out << "<table border=\"0\" width=\"100%\">"                      << endl;

02154     *out << "       align=\"middle\""                                  << endl;
02155     *out << "       src=\"/rubuilder/fu/images/debug32x32.gif\""         << endl;
02156     *out << "       alt=\"debug\""                                     << endl;
02157     *out << "       width=\"32\""                                      << endl;
02158     *out << "       height=\"32\""                                     << endl;
02159     *out << "       border=\"\"/>"                                     << endl;
02160     *out << "    </a>"                                                 << endl;
02161     *out << "  </td>"                                                  << endl;
02162     *out << "</tr>"                                                    << endl;
02163     if(fsm_.stateName()->value_ == "Failed")
02164     {

02174     *out << "</table>"                                                 << endl;
02175

02177 
02178 // now for RB sender list statistics

02181   *out << "  <td>"                                                   << endl;
02182

02184   *out << "<colgroup> <colgroup align=\"rigth\">"                    << endl;
02185     *out << "  <tr>"                                                   << endl;
02186     *out << "    <th colspan=2>"                                       << endl;

02195     *out << "<th>" << endl;

02204           *out << smrbsenders_.numberOfRB() << endl;
02205           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02206         *out << "  </tr>" << endl;
02207         *out << "<tr>" << endl;
02208           *out << "<td >" << endl;
02209           *out << "Number of OM per FU" << endl;
02210           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02211           *out << "<td>" << endl;
02212           *out << smrbsenders_.numberOfOM() << endl;
02213           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02214         *out << "  </tr>" << endl;
02215         *out << "<tr>" << endl;
02216           *out << "<td >" << endl;
02217           *out << "Number in list of senders" << endl;
02218           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02219           *out << "<td>" << endl;
02220           *out << smrbsenders_.size() << endl;
02221           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02222         *out << "  </tr>" << endl;
02223     std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<SMFUSenderStats> > vrbstats = smrbsenders_.getSenderStats();
02224     if(!vrbstats.empty()) {
02225       for(vector<boost::shared_ptr<SMFUSenderStats> >::iterator pos = vrbstats.begin();
02226           pos != vrbstats.end(); ++pos)
02227       {
02228         *out << "<tr>" << endl;

02231           *out << "</td>" << endl;

02233           char hlturl[MAX_I2O_SM_URLCHARS];
02234           copy(&(((*pos)->hltURL_)->at(0)), 
02235                &(((*pos)->hltURL_)->at(0)) + ((*pos)->hltURL_)->size(),
02236                hlturl);
02237           hlturl[((*pos)->hltURL_)->size()] = '\0';
02238           *out << hlturl << endl;
02239           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02240         *out << "  </tr>" << endl;
02241         *out << "<tr>" << endl;

02244           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02245           *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
02246           char hltclass[MAX_I2O_SM_URLCHARS];
02247           copy(&(((*pos)->hltClassName_)->at(0)), 
02248                &(((*pos)->hltClassName_)->at(0)) + ((*pos)->hltClassName_)->size(),
02249                hltclass);
02250           hltclass[((*pos)->hltClassName_)->size()] = '\0';
02251           *out << hltclass << endl;
02252           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02253         *out << "  </tr>" << endl;
02254         *out << "<tr>" << endl;

02257           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02258           *out << "<td align=right>" << endl;
02259           *out << (*pos)->hltInstance_ << endl;
02260           *out << "</td>" << endl;
02261         *out << "  </tr>" << endl;
02262         *out << "<tr>" << endl;
