04031                  << consPtr->getDataRate(ConsumerPipe::LONG_TERM,
04032                                          ConsumerPipe::SERVED_EVENTS,
04033                                          now)
04034                  << "</td>" << std::endl;
04035             *out << "  <td align=\"center\">"
04036                  << consPtr->getDuration(ConsumerPipe::LONG_TERM,
04037                                          ConsumerPipe::SERVED_EVENTS,
04038                                          now)
04039                  << "</td>" << std::endl;
04040             *out << "</tr>" << std::endl;
04041           }
04042 
04043           // add a row with the totals
04044           if (displayedConsumerCount > 1) {
04045             *out << "<tr>" << std::endl;
04046             *out << "  <td align=\"center\">&nbsp;</td>" << std::endl;
04047             *out << "  <td align=\"center\">Totals</td>" << std::endl;
04048             *out << "  <td align=\"center\">" << eventSum << "</td>" << std::endl;
04049             *out << "  <td align=\"center\">" << eventRateSum << "</td>" << std::endl;
04050             *out << "  <td align=\"center\">" << dataRateSum << "</td>" << std::endl;
04051             *out << "  <td align=\"center\">&nbsp;</td>" << std::endl;
04052             *out << "</tr>" << std::endl;
04053           }
04054           *out << "</table>" << std::endl;
04055         }
04056       }
04057       else
04058       {
04059         *out << "<br/>Waiting for INIT messages from the filter units...<br/>"
04060              << std::endl;
04061       }
04062     }
04063     else
04064     {
04065       *out << "<br/>The system is unable to fetch the Event Server "
04066            << "instance or the Init Message Collection instance. "
04067            << "This is a (very) unexpected error and could "
04068            << "be caused by an uninitialized JobController.<br/>"
04069            << std::endl;
04070     }
04071 
04072     if(jc_->getInitMsgCollection().get() != NULL &&
04073        jc_->getInitMsgCollection()->size() > 0)
04074     {
04075       boost::shared_ptr<InitMsgCollection> initMsgCollection =
04076         jc_->getInitMsgCollection();
04077       *out << "<h3>HLT Trigger Paths:</h3>" << std::endl;
04078       *out << "<table border=\"1\" width=\"100%\">" << std::endl;
04079 
04080       {
04081         InitMsgSharedPtr serializedProds = initMsgCollection->getLastElement();
04082         InitMsgView initView(&(*serializedProds)[0]);
04083         Strings triggerNameList;
04084         initView.hltTriggerNames(triggerNameList);
04085 
04086         *out << "<tr>" << std::endl;
04087         *out << "  <td align=\"left\" valign=\"top\">"
04088              << "Full Trigger List</td>" << std::endl;
04089         *out << "  <td align=\"left\" valign=\"top\">"
04090              << InitMsgCollection::stringsToText(triggerNameList, 0)
04091              << "</td>" << std::endl;
04092         *out << "</tr>" << std::endl;
04093       }
04094 
04095       for (int idx = 0; idx < initMsgCollection->size(); ++idx) {
04096         InitMsgSharedPtr serializedProds = initMsgCollection->getElementAt(idx);
04097         InitMsgView initView(&(*serializedProds)[0]);
04098         Strings triggerSelectionList;
04099         initView.hltTriggerSelections(triggerSelectionList);
04100 
04101         *out << "<tr>" << std::endl;
04102         *out << "  <td align=\"left\" valign=\"top\">"
04103              << initView.outputModuleLabel()
04104              << " Output Module</td>" << std::endl;
04105         *out << "  <td align=\"left\" valign=\"top\">"
04106              << InitMsgCollection::stringsToText(triggerSelectionList, 0)
04107              << "</td>" << std::endl;
04108         *out << "</tr>" << std::endl;
04109       }
04110 
04111       *out << "</table>" << std::endl;
04112     }
04113   }
04114   else
04115   {
04116     *out << "<br/>Event server statistics are only available when the "
04117          << "Storage Manager is in the Enabled state.<br/>" << std::endl;
04118   }
04119 
04120   *out << "<br/><hr/>" << std::endl;
04121   char timeString[64];
04122   time_t now = time(0);
04123   strftime(timeString, 60, "%d-%b-%Y %H:%M:%S %Z", localtime(&now));
04124   *out << "Last updated: " << timeString << std::endl;;
04125   *out << "</body>" << std::endl;
04126   *out << "</html>" << std::endl;
04127 }
04128 
04130 void StorageManager::consumerWebPage(xgi::Input *in, xgi::Output *out)
04131   throw (xgi::exception::Exception)
04132 {
04133   if(fsm_.stateName()->toString() == "Enabled")
04134   { // what is the right place for this?
04135 
04136   std::string consumerName = "None provided";
04137   std::string consumerPriority = "normal";
04138   std::string consumerRequest = "<>";
04139   std::string consumerHost = in->getenv("REMOTE_HOST");
04140 
04141   // read the consumer registration message from the http input stream
04142   std::string lengthString = in->getenv("CONTENT_LENGTH");
04143   unsigned long contentLength = std::atol(lengthString.c_str());
04144   if (contentLength > 0)
04145   {
04146     auto_ptr< vector<char> > bufPtr(new vector<char>(contentLength));
04147     in->read(&(*bufPtr)[0], contentLength);
04148     ConsRegRequestView requestMessage(&(*bufPtr)[0]);
04149     consumerName = requestMessage.getConsumerName();
04150     consumerPriority = requestMessage.getConsumerPriority();
04151     std::string reqString = requestMessage.getRequestParameterSet();
04152     if (reqString.size() >= 2) consumerRequest = reqString;
04153   }
04154 
04155   // resize the local buffer, if needed, to handle a minimal response message
04156   unsigned int responseSize = 200;
04157   if (mybuffer_.capacity() < responseSize) mybuffer_.resize(responseSize);
04158 
04159   // fetch the event server
04160   // (it and/or the job controller may not have been created yet)
04161   boost::shared_ptr<EventServer> eventServer;
04162   if (jc_.get() != NULL)
04163   {
04164     eventServer = jc_->getEventServer();
04165   }
04166 
04167   // if no event server, tell the consumer that we're not ready
04168   if (eventServer.get() == NULL)
04169   {
04170     // build the registration response into the message buffer
04171     ConsRegResponseBuilder respMsg(&mybuffer_[0], mybuffer_.capacity(),
04172                                    ConsRegResponseBuilder::ES_NOT_READY, 0);
04173     // debug message so that compiler thinks respMsg is used
04174     FDEBUG(20) << "Registration response size =  " <<
04175       respMsg.size() << std::endl;
04176   }
04177   else
04178   {
04179     // resize the local buffer, if needed, to handle a full response message
04180     int mapStringSize = eventServer->getSelectionTableStringSize();
04181     responseSize += (int) (2.5 * mapStringSize);
04182     if (mybuffer_.capacity() < responseSize) mybuffer_.resize(responseSize);
04183 
04184     // fetch the event selection request from the consumer request
04185     edm::ParameterSet requestParamSet(consumerRequest);
04186 
04187     // 26-Jan-2009, KAB: an ugly hack to get ParameterSet to serialize
04188     // the parameters that we need.  A better solution is in the works.
04189     try {
04190       double rate =
04191         requestParamSet.getUntrackedParameter<double>("maxEventRequestRate",
04192                                                       -999.0);
04193       if (rate == -999.0) {
04194         rate = requestParamSet.getParameter<double>("TrackedMaxRate");
04195         requestParamSet.addUntrackedParameter<double>("maxEventRequestRate",
04196                                                       rate);
04197       }
04198     }
04199     catch (...) {}
04200     try {
04201       std::string hltOMLabel =
04202         requestParamSet.getUntrackedParameter<std::string>("SelectHLTOutput",
04203                                                            "NoneFound");
04204       if (hltOMLabel == "NoneFound") {
04205         hltOMLabel =
04206           requestParamSet.getParameter<std::string>("TrackedHLTOutMod");
04207         requestParamSet.addUntrackedParameter<std::string>("SelectHLTOutput",
04208                                                            hltOMLabel);
04209       }
04210     }
04211     catch (...) {}
04212     try {
04213       edm::ParameterSet tmpPSet1 =
04214         requestParamSet.getUntrackedParameter<edm::ParameterSet>("SelectEvents",
04215                                                                  edm::ParameterSet());
04216       if (tmpPSet1.empty()) {
04217         Strings path_specs = 
04218           requestParamSet.getParameter<Strings>("TrackedEventSelection");
04219         if (! path_specs.empty()) {
04220           edm::ParameterSet tmpPSet2;
04221           tmpPSet2.addParameter<Strings>("SelectEvents", path_specs);
04222           requestParamSet.addUntrackedParameter<edm::ParameterSet>("SelectEvents",
04223                                                                    tmpPSet2);
04224         }
04225       }
04226     }
04227     catch (...) {}
04228 
04229     Strings selectionRequest =
04230       EventSelector::getEventSelectionVString(requestParamSet);
04231     Strings modifiedRequest =
04232       eventServer->updateTriggerSelectionForStreams(selectionRequest);
04233 
04234     // pull the rate request out of the consumer parameter set, too
04235     double maxEventRequestRate =
04236       requestParamSet.getUntrackedParameter<double>("maxEventRequestRate", 1.0);
04237 
04238     // pull the HLT output module selection out of the PSet
04239     // (default is empty string)
04240     std::string hltOMLabel =
04241       requestParamSet.getUntrackedParameter<std::string>("SelectHLTOutput",
04242                                                          std::string());
04243 
04244     // create the local consumer interface and add it to the event server
04245     boost::shared_ptr<ConsumerPipe>
04246       consPtr(new ConsumerPipe(consumerName, consumerPriority,
04247                                activeConsumerTimeout_.value_,
04248                                idleConsumerTimeout_.value_,
04249                                modifiedRequest, maxEventRequestRate,
04250                                hltOMLabel,
04251                                consumerHost, consumerQueueSize_));
04252     eventServer->addConsumer(consPtr);
04253     // over-ride pushmode if not set in StorageManager
04254     if((consumerPriority.compare("PushMode") == 0) && !pushMode_)
04255         consPtr->setPushMode(false);
04256 
04257     // build the registration response into the message buffer
04258     ConsRegResponseBuilder respMsg(&mybuffer_[0], mybuffer_.capacity(),
04259                                    0, consPtr->getConsumerId());
04260 
04261     // add the stream selection table to the proxy server response
04262     if (consPtr->isProxyServer()) {
04263       respMsg.setStreamSelectionTable(eventServer->getStreamSelectionTable());
04264     }
04265 
04266     // debug message so that compiler thinks respMsg is used
04267     FDEBUG(20) << "Registration response size =  " <<
04268       respMsg.size() << std::endl;
04269   }
04270 
04271   // send the response
04272   ConsRegResponseView responseMessage(&mybuffer_[0]);
04273   unsigned int len = responseMessage.size();
04274 
04275   out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Type", "application/octet-stream");
04276   out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
04277   out->write((char*) &mybuffer_[0],len);
04278 
04279   } else { // is this the right thing to send?
04280    // In wrong state for this message - return zero length stream, should return Msg NOTREADY
04281    int len = 0;
04282    out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Type", "application/octet-stream");
04283    out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
04284    out->write((char*) &mybuffer_[0],len);
04285   }
04286 
04287 }
04288 
04290 void StorageManager::DQMeventdataWebPage(xgi::Input *in, xgi::Output *out)
04291   throw (xgi::exception::Exception)
04292 {
04293   // default the message length to zero
04294   int len=0;
04295 
04296   // determine the consumer ID from the event request
04297   // message, if it is available.
04298   unsigned int consumerId = 0;
04299   std::string lengthString = in->getenv("CONTENT_LENGTH");
04300   unsigned int contentLength = std::atol(lengthString.c_str());
04301   if (contentLength > 0) 
04302   {
04303     auto_ptr< vector<char> > bufPtr(new vector<char>(contentLength));
04304     in->read(&(*bufPtr)[0], contentLength);
04305     OtherMessageView requestMessage(&(*bufPtr)[0]);
04306     if (requestMessage.code() == Header::DQMEVENT_REQUEST)
04307     {
04308       uint8 *bodyPtr = requestMessage.msgBody();
04309       consumerId = convert32(bodyPtr);
04310     }
04311   }
04312   
04313   // first test if StorageManager is in Enabled state and this is a valid request
04314   // there must also be DQM data available
04315   if(fsm_.stateName()->toString() == "Enabled" && consumerId != 0)
04316   {
04317     boost::shared_ptr<DQMEventServer> eventServer;
04318     if (jc_.get() != NULL)
04319     {
04320       eventServer = jc_->getDQMEventServer();
04321     }
04322     if (eventServer.get() != NULL)
04323     {
04324       boost::shared_ptr< std::vector<char> > bufPtr =
04325         eventServer->getDQMEvent(consumerId);
04326       if (bufPtr.get() != NULL)
04327       {
04328         DQMEventMsgView msgView(&(*bufPtr)[0]);
04329 
04330         // what if mybuffer_ is used in multiple threads? Can it happen?
04331         unsigned char* from = msgView.startAddress();
04332         unsigned int dsize = msgView.size();
04333         if(mybuffer_.capacity() < dsize) mybuffer_.resize(dsize);
04334         unsigned char* pos = (unsigned char*) &mybuffer_[0];
04335 
04336         copy(from,from+dsize,pos);
04337         len = dsize;
04338         FDEBUG(10) << "sending update at event " << msgView.eventNumberAtUpdate() << std::endl;
04339       }
04340     }
04341     
04342     // check if zero length is sent when there is no valid data
04343     // i.e. on getDQMEvent, can already send zero length if request is invalid
04344     out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Type", "application/octet-stream");
04345     out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
04346     out->write((char*) &mybuffer_[0],len);
04347   } // else send DONE as reponse (could be end of a run)
04348   else
04349   {
04350     // not an event request or not in enabled state, just send DONE message
04351     OtherMessageBuilder othermsg(&mybuffer_[0],Header::DONE);
04352     len = othermsg.size();
04353       
04354     out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Type", "application/octet-stream");
04355     out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
04356     out->write((char*) &mybuffer_[0],len);
04357   }
04358   
04359 }
04360 
04362 void StorageManager::DQMconsumerWebPage(xgi::Input *in, xgi::Output *out)
04363   throw (xgi::exception::Exception)
04364 {
04365   if(fsm_.stateName()->toString() == "Enabled")
04366   { // We need to be in the enabled state
04367 
04368     std::string consumerName = "None provided";
04369     std::string consumerPriority = "normal";
04370     std::string consumerRequest = "*";
04371     std::string consumerHost = in->getenv("REMOTE_HOST");
04372 
04373     // read the consumer registration message from the http input stream
04374     std::string lengthString = in->getenv("CONTENT_LENGTH");
04375     unsigned int contentLength = std::atol(lengthString.c_str());
04376     if (contentLength > 0)
04377     {
04378       auto_ptr< vector<char> > bufPtr(new vector<char>(contentLength));
04379       in->read(&(*bufPtr)[0], contentLength);
04380       ConsRegRequestView requestMessage(&(*bufPtr)[0]);
04381       consumerName = requestMessage.getConsumerName();
04382       consumerPriority = requestMessage.getConsumerPriority();
04383       // for DQM consumers top folder name is stored in the "parameteSet"
04384       std::string reqFolder = requestMessage.getRequestParameterSet();
04385       if (reqFolder.size() >= 1) consumerRequest = reqFolder;
04386     }
04387 
04388     // create the buffer to hold the registration reply message
04389     const int BUFFER_SIZE = 100;
04390     char msgBuff[BUFFER_SIZE];
04391 
04392     // fetch the DQMevent server
04393     // (it and/or the job controller may not have been created yet
04394     //  if not in the enabled state)
04395     boost::shared_ptr<DQMEventServer> eventServer;
04396     if (jc_.get() != NULL)
04397     {
04398       eventServer = jc_->getDQMEventServer();
04399     }
04400 
04401     // if no event server, tell the consumer that we're not ready
04402     if (eventServer.get() == NULL)
04403     {
04404       // build the registration response into the message buffer
04405       ConsRegResponseBuilder respMsg(msgBuff, BUFFER_SIZE,
04406                                      ConsRegResponseBuilder::ES_NOT_READY, 0);
04407       // debug message so that compiler thinks respMsg is used
04408       FDEBUG(20) << "Registration response size =  " <<
04409         respMsg.size() << std::endl;
04410     }
04411     else
04412     {
04413       // create the local consumer interface and add it to the event server
04414       boost::shared_ptr<DQMConsumerPipe>
04415         consPtr(new DQMConsumerPipe(consumerName, consumerPriority,
04416                                     DQMactiveConsumerTimeout_.value_,
04417                                     DQMidleConsumerTimeout_.value_,
04418                                     consumerRequest, consumerHost,
04419                                     DQMconsumerQueueSize_));
04420       eventServer->addConsumer(consPtr);
04421       // over-ride pushmode if not set in StorageManager
04422       if((consumerPriority.compare("PushMode") == 0) && !pushMode_)
04423           consPtr->setPushMode(false);
04424 
04425       // initialize it straight away (should later pass in the folder name to
04426       // optionally change the selection on a register?
04427       consPtr->initializeSelection();
04428 
04429       // build the registration response into the message buffer
04430       ConsRegResponseBuilder respMsg(msgBuff, BUFFER_SIZE,
04431                                      0, consPtr->getConsumerId());
04432       // debug message so that compiler thinks respMsg is used
04433       FDEBUG(20) << "Registration response size =  " <<
04434         respMsg.size() << std::endl;
04435     }
04436 
04437     // send the response
04438     ConsRegResponseView responseMessage(msgBuff);
04439     unsigned int len = responseMessage.size();
04440     if(mybuffer_.capacity() < len) mybuffer_.resize(len);
04441     for (unsigned int i=0; i<len; ++i) mybuffer_[i]=msgBuff[i];
04442 
04443     out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Type", "application/octet-stream");
04444     out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
04445     out->write((char*) &mybuffer_[0],len);
04446 
04447   } else { // is this the right thing to send?
04448    // In wrong state for this message - return zero length stream, should return Msg NOTREADY
04449    int len = 0;
04450    out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Type", "application/octet-stream");
04451    out->getHTTPResponseHeader().addHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
04452    out->write((char*) &mybuffer_[0],len);
04453   }
04454 
04455 }
04456 
04457 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04458 // Everything that has to do with the flash list goes here
04459 // 
04460 // - setupFlashList()                  - setup variables and initialize them
04461 // - actionPerformed(xdata::Event &e)  - update values in flash list
04462 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04463 void StorageManager::setupFlashList()
04464 {
04465   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04466   // Setup the header variables
04467   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04468   class_    = getApplicationDescriptor()->getClassName();
04469   instance_ = getApplicationDescriptor()->getInstance();
04470   std::string url;
04471   url       = getApplicationDescriptor()->getContextDescriptor()->getURL();
04472   url      += "/";
04473   url      += getApplicationDescriptor()->getURN();
04474   url_      = url;
04475 
04476   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04477   // Create/Retrieve an infospace which can be monitored
04478   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04479   std::ostringstream oss;
04480   oss << "urn:xdaq-monitorable-" << class_.value_;
04481   toolbox::net::URN urn = this->createQualifiedInfoSpace(oss.str());
04482   xdata::InfoSpace *is = xdata::getInfoSpaceFactory()->get(urn.toString());
04483 
04484   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04485   // Publish monitor data in monitorable info space -- Head
04486   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04487   is->fireItemAvailable("class",                &class_);
04488   is->fireItemAvailable("instance",             &instance_);
04489   is->fireItemAvailable("runNumber",            &runNumber_);
04490   is->fireItemAvailable("url",                  &url_);
04491   // Body
04492   is->fireItemAvailable("receivedFrames",       &receivedFrames_);
04493   // should this be here also??
04494   is->fireItemAvailable("storedEvents",         &storedEvents_);
04495   is->fireItemAvailable("closedFiles",          &closedFiles_);
04496   is->fireItemAvailable("receivedEvents",       &receivedEvents_);
04497   is->fireItemAvailable("receivedErrorEvents",  &receivedErrorEvents_);
04498   is->fireItemAvailable("namesOfStream",      &namesOfStream_);
04499   is->fireItemAvailable("namesOfOutMod",      &namesOfOutMod_);
04500   is->fireItemAvailable("dqmRecords",           &dqmRecords_);
04501   is->fireItemAvailable("receivedVolume",       &receivedVolume_);
04502   is->fireItemAvailable("storedVolume",         &storedVolume_);
04503   is->fireItemAvailable("memoryUsed",           &memoryUsed_);
04504   is->fireItemAvailable("instantBandwidth",     &instantBandwidth_);
04505   is->fireItemAvailable("instantRate",          &instantRate_);
04506   is->fireItemAvailable("instantLatency",       &instantLatency_);
04507   is->fireItemAvailable("maxBandwidth",         &maxBandwidth_);
04508   is->fireItemAvailable("minBandwidth",         &minBandwidth_);
04509   is->fireItemAvailable("duration",             &duration_);
04510   is->fireItemAvailable("totalSamples",         &totalSamples_);
04511   is->fireItemAvailable("meanBandwidth",        &meanBandwidth_);
04512   is->fireItemAvailable("meanRate",             &meanRate_);
04513   is->fireItemAvailable("meanLatency",          &meanLatency_);
04514   is->fireItemAvailable("STparameterSet",       &offConfig_);
04515   is->fireItemAvailable("stateName",            fsm_.stateName());
04516   is->fireItemAvailable("progressMarker",       &progressMarker_);
04517   is->fireItemAvailable("connectedRBs",         &connectedRBs_);
04518   is->fireItemAvailable("pushMode2Proxy",       &pushmode2proxy_);
04519   is->fireItemAvailable("collateDQM",           &collateDQM_);
04520   is->fireItemAvailable("archiveDQM",           &archiveDQM_);
04521   is->fireItemAvailable("archiveIntervalDQM",   &archiveIntervalDQM_);
04522   is->fireItemAvailable("purgeTimeDQM",         &purgeTimeDQM_);
04523   is->fireItemAvailable("readyTimeDQM",         &readyTimeDQM_);
04524   is->fireItemAvailable("filePrefixDQM",        &filePrefixDQM_);
04525   is->fireItemAvailable("useCompressionDQM",    &useCompressionDQM_);
04526   is->fireItemAvailable("compressionLevelDQM",  &compressionLevelDQM_);
04527   is->fireItemAvailable("nLogicalDisk",         &nLogicalDisk_);
04528   is->fireItemAvailable("fileCatalog",          &fileCatalog_);
04529   is->fireItemAvailable("fileName",             &fileName_);
04530   is->fireItemAvailable("filePath",             &filePath_);
04531   is->fireItemAvailable("setupLabel",           &setupLabel_);
04532   is->fireItemAvailable("highWaterMark",        &highWaterMark_);
04533   is->fireItemAvailable("lumiSectionTimeOut",   &lumiSectionTimeOut_);
04534   is->fireItemAvailable("exactFileSizeTest",    &exactFileSizeTest_);
04535   is->fireItemAvailable("fileClosingTestInterval",&fileClosingTestInterval_);
04536   is->fireItemAvailable("maxESEventRate",       &maxESEventRate_);
04537   is->fireItemAvailable("maxESDataRate",        &maxESDataRate_);
04538   is->fireItemAvailable("activeConsumerTimeout",&activeConsumerTimeout_);
04539   is->fireItemAvailable("idleConsumerTimeout",  &idleConsumerTimeout_);
04540   is->fireItemAvailable("consumerQueueSize",    &consumerQueueSize_);
04541   is->fireItemAvailable("esSelectedHLTOutputModule",&esSelectedHLTOutputModule_);
04542   //is->fireItemAvailable("fairShareES",          &fairShareES_);
04543 
04544   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04545   // Attach listener to myCounter_ to detect retrieval event
04546   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04547   is->addItemRetrieveListener("class",                this);
04548   is->addItemRetrieveListener("instance",             this);
04549   is->addItemRetrieveListener("runNumber",            this);
04550   is->addItemRetrieveListener("url",                  this);
04551   // Body
04552   is->addItemRetrieveListener("receivedFrames",       this);
04553   // should this be here also??
04554   //is->addItemRetrieveListener("storedEvents",         this);
04555   is->addItemRetrieveListener("receivedEvents",       this);
04556   is->addItemRetrieveListener("namesOfStream", this);
04557   is->addItemRetrieveListener("namesOfOutMod", this);
04558   is->addItemRetrieveListener("dqmRecords",           this);
04559   is->addItemRetrieveListener("receivedVolume",       this);
04560   is->addItemRetrieveListener("storedVolume",         this);
04561   is->addItemRetrieveListener("memoryUsed",           this);
04562   is->addItemRetrieveListener("instantBandwidth",     this);
04563   is->addItemRetrieveListener("instantRate",          this);
04564   is->addItemRetrieveListener("instantLatency",       this);
04565   is->addItemRetrieveListener("maxBandwidth",         this);
04566   is->addItemRetrieveListener("minBandwidth",         this);
04567   is->addItemRetrieveListener("duration",             this);
04568   is->addItemRetrieveListener("totalSamples",         this);
04569   is->addItemRetrieveListener("meanBandwidth",        this);
04570   is->addItemRetrieveListener("meanRate",             this);
04571   is->addItemRetrieveListener("meanLatency",          this);
04572   is->addItemRetrieveListener("STparameterSet",       this);
04573   is->addItemRetrieveListener("stateName",            this);
04574   is->addItemRetrieveListener("progressMarker",       this);
04575   is->addItemRetrieveListener("connectedRBs",         this);
04576   is->addItemRetrieveListener("pushMode2Proxy",       this);
04577   is->addItemRetrieveListener("collateDQM",           this);
04578   is->addItemRetrieveListener("archiveDQM",           this);
04579   is->addItemRetrieveListener("archiveIntervalDQM",   this);
04580   is->addItemRetrieveListener("purgeTimeDQM",         this);
04581   is->addItemRetrieveListener("readyTimeDQM",         this);
04582   is->addItemRetrieveListener("filePrefixDQM",        this);
04583   is->addItemRetrieveListener("useCompressionDQM",    this);
04584   is->addItemRetrieveListener("compressionLevelDQM",  this);
04585   is->addItemRetrieveListener("nLogicalDisk",         this);
04586   is->addItemRetrieveListener("fileCatalog",          this);
04587   is->addItemRetrieveListener("fileName",             this);
04588   is->addItemRetrieveListener("filePath",             this);
04589   is->addItemRetrieveListener("setupLabel",           this);
04590   is->addItemRetrieveListener("highWaterMark",        this);
04591   is->addItemRetrieveListener("lumiSectionTimeOut",   this);
04592   is->addItemRetrieveListener("exactFileSizeTest",    this);
04593   is->addItemRetrieveListener("fileClosingTestInterval",this);
04594   is->addItemRetrieveListener("maxESEventRate",       this);
04595   is->addItemRetrieveListener("maxESDataRate",        this);
04596   is->addItemRetrieveListener("activeConsumerTimeout",this);
04597   is->addItemRetrieveListener("idleConsumerTimeout",  this);
04598   is->addItemRetrieveListener("consumerQueueSize",    this);
04599   is->addItemRetrieveListener("esSelectedHLTOutputModule",this);
04600   //is->addItemRetrieveListener("fairShareES",          this);
04601   //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
04602 }
04603 
04604 
04605 void StorageManager::actionPerformed(xdata::Event& e)  
04606 {
04607   // 14-Oct-2008, KAB - skip all processing in this method, for now,
04608   // when the SM state is halted.  This will protect against the use
04609   // of un-initialized variables (like jc_).
04610   if (fsm_.stateName()->toString()=="Halted") {return;}
04611   if (fsm_.stateName()->toString()=="halting") {return;}
04612   // paranoia - also return if jc_.get() is null.  Although, to do this
04613   // right, we would need a lock
04614   if (jc_.get() == 0) {return;}
04615 
04616   if (e.type() == "ItemRetrieveEvent") {
04617     std::ostringstream oss;
04618     oss << "urn:xdaq-monitorable:" << class_.value_ << ":" << instance_.value_;
04619     xdata::InfoSpace *is = xdata::InfoSpace::get(oss.str());
04620 
04621     is->lock();
04622     std::string item = dynamic_cast<xdata::ItemRetrieveEvent&>(e).itemName();
04623     // Only update those locations which are not always up to date
04624     if      (item == "connectedRBs")
04625       connectedRBs_   = smrbsenders_.size();
04626     else if (item == "memoryUsed")
04627       memoryUsed_     = pool_->getMemoryUsage().getUsed();
04628     else if (item == "receivedVolume")
04629       receivedVolume_   = pmeter_->totalvolumemb();
04630     else if (item == "storedVolume")
04631       //storedVolume_   = pmeter_->totalvolumemb();
04632       storedVolume_   = store_receivedVolume_;
04633     else if (item == "closedFiles") {
04634         std::list<std::string>& files = jc_->get_filelist();
04635         std::list<std::string>& currfiles= jc_->get_currfiles();
04636         closedFiles_ = files.size() - currfiles.size();
04637     } else if (item == "openFiles") {
04638         std::list<std::string>& currfiles= jc_->get_currfiles();
04639         openFiles_ = currfiles.size();
04640     } else if (item == "receivedEventsFromOutMod" || item == "namesOfOutMod") {
04641       receivedEventsFromOutMod_.clear();
04642       namesOfOutMod_.clear();
04643 
04644       boost::shared_ptr<InitMsgCollection> initMsgCollection;
04645       if(jc_.get() != NULL && jc_->getInitMsgCollection().get() != NULL) {
04646         initMsgCollection = jc_->getInitMsgCollection();
04647       }
04648       idMap_iter oi(modId2ModOutMap_.begin()), oe(modId2ModOutMap_.end());
04649       for( ; oi != oe; ++oi) {
04650         std::string outputModuleLabel = oi->second;
04651         if (initMsgCollection.get() != NULL &&
04652             initMsgCollection->getOutputModuleName(oi->first) != "") {
04653           outputModuleLabel = initMsgCollection->getOutputModuleName(oi->first);
04654         }
04655         receivedEventsFromOutMod_.push_back(receivedEventsMap_[oi->second]);
04656         namesOfOutMod_.push_back(outputModuleLabel);
04657       }
04658 /* removed for temporary solution of using the monitoring loop
04659 
04660     } else if (item == "storedEvents" || item == "storedEventsInStream" || item == "namesOfStream") {
04661       // only clear and get values if in enabled state so latest values available if fail/stop
04662       if(jc_.get() != NULL) {
04663         storedEvents_ = 0;
04664         storedEventsInStream_.clear();
04665         namesOfStream_.clear();
04666         // following is thread safe as size of all_storedEvents is fixed (number of streams)
04667         std::vector<uint32> all_storedEvents = jc_->get_storedEvents();
04668         std::vector<std::string> all_storedNames = jc_->get_storedNames();
04669         for(std::vector<uint32>::iterator it = all_storedEvents.begin(), itEnd = all_storedEvents.end();
04670             it != itEnd; ++it) {
04671               storedEvents_ = storedEvents_ + (*it);
04672               storedEventsInStream_.push_back(*it);
04673         }
04674         for(std::vector<std::string>::iterator it = all_storedNames.begin(), itEnd = all_storedNames.end();
04675             it != itEnd; ++it) {
04676               namesOfStream_.push_back(*it);
04677         }
04678       }
04679 */
04680     } else if (item == "progressMarker")
04681       progressMarker_ = ProgressMarker::instance()->status();
04682     is->unlock();
04683   }
04684 
04685   if (e.type()=="ItemChangedEvent" && !(fsm_.stateName()->toString()=="Halted")) {
04686     string item = dynamic_cast<xdata::ItemChangedEvent&>(e).itemName();
04687     if ( item == "STparameterSet") {
04688       reconfigurationRequested_ = true;
04689     }
04690   }
04691 }
04692 
04693 
04694 std::string StorageManager::findStreamName(const std::string &in) const
04695 {
04696   //cout << "in findStreamName with string " << in << endl;
04697   string::size_type t = in.find("storageManager");
04698 
04699   string::size_type b;
04700   if(t != string::npos)
04701     {
04702       //cout << " storageManager is at " << t << endl;
04703       b = in.rfind(".",t-2);
04704       if(b!=string::npos) 
04705   {
04706     //cout << "looking for substring " << t-b-2 << "long" <<endl;
04707     //cout << " stream name should be at " << b+1 << endl;
04708     //cout << " will return name " << string(in.substr(b+1,t-b-2)) << endl;
04709     return string(in.substr(b+1,t-b-2));
04710   }
04711       else
04712   cout << " stream name is lost " << endl;
04713     }
04714   else
04715     cout << " storageManager is not found " << endl;
04716   return in;
04717 }
04718 
04719 
04720 bool StorageManager::configuring(toolbox::task::WorkLoop* wl)
04721 {
04722   try {
04723     LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Start configuring ...");
04724 
04725     configureAction();
04726 
04727     LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Finished configuring!");
04728 
04729     fsm_.fireEvent("ConfigureDone",this);
04730   }
04731   catch (cms::Exception& e) {
04732     reasonForFailedState_ = e.explainSelf();
04733     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
04734     return false;
04735   }
04736   catch (xcept::Exception &e) {
04737     reasonForFailedState_ = "configuring FAILED: " + (string)e.what();
04738     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
04739     return false;
04740   }
04741   catch (std::exception& e) {
04742     reasonForFailedState_  = e.what();
04743     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
04744     return false;
04745   }
04746   catch (...) {
04747     reasonForFailedState_  = "Unknown Exception while configuring";
04748     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
04749     return false;
04750   }
04751 
04752   reconfigurationRequested_ = false;
04753   return false;
04754 }
04755 
04756 
04757 void StorageManager::configureAction()
04758 {
04759   if(!edmplugin::PluginManager::isAvailable()) {
04760     edmplugin::PluginManager::configure(edmplugin::standard::config());
04761   }
04762     
04763   // give the JobController a configuration string and
04764   // get the registry data coming over the network (the first one)
04765   // Note that there is currently no run number check for the INIT
04766   // message, just the first one received once in Enabled state is used
04767   evf::ParameterSetRetriever smpset(offConfig_.value_);
04768 
04769   string my_config = smpset.getAsString();
04770 
04771   pushMode_ = (bool) pushmode2proxy_;
04772   smConfigString_    = my_config;
04773   smFileCatalog_     = fileCatalog_.toString();
04774 
04775   boost::shared_ptr<stor::Parameter> smParameter_ = stor::Configurator::instance()->getParameter();
04776   smParameter_ -> setFileCatalog(fileCatalog_.toString());
04777   smParameter_ -> setfileName(fileName_.toString());
04778   smParameter_ -> setfilePath(filePath_.toString());
04779   smParameter_ -> setmaxFileSize(maxFileSize_.value_);
04780   smParameter_ -> setsetupLabel(setupLabel_.toString());
04781   smParameter_ -> sethighWaterMark(highWaterMark_.value_);
04782   smParameter_ -> setlumiSectionTimeOut(lumiSectionTimeOut_.value_);
04783   smParameter_ -> setExactFileSizeTest(exactFileSizeTest_.value_);
04784 
04785   // check output locations and scripts before we continue
04786   checkDirectoryOK(filePath_);
04787   if((bool)archiveDQM_) checkDirectoryOK(filePrefixDQM_.toString());
04788 
04789   // check whether the maxSize parameter in an SM output stream
04790   // is still specified in bytes (rather than MBytes).  (All we really
04791   // check is if the maxSize is unreasonably large after converting
04792   // it to bytes.)
04793   //@@EM this is done on the xdaq parameter if it is set (i.e. if >0),
04794   // otherwise on the cfg params
04795   if(smParameter_ ->maxFileSize()>0) {
04796     long long maxSize = 1048576 * (long long) smParameter_ -> maxFileSize();
04797     if (maxSize > 2E+13) {
04798       std::string errorString =  "The maxSize parameter (file size) ";
04799       errorString.append("from xdaq configuration is too large(");
04800       try {
04801         errorString.append(boost::lexical_cast<std::string>(maxSize));
04802       }
04803       catch (boost::bad_lexical_cast& blcExcpt) {
04804         errorString.append("???");
04805       }
04806       errorString.append(" bytes). ");
04807       errorString.append("Please check that this parameter is ");
04808       errorString.append("specified as the number of MBytes, not bytes. ");
04809       errorString.append("(The units for maxSize was changed from ");
04810       errorString.append("bytes to MBytes, and it is possible that ");
04811       errorString.append("your storage manager configuration ");
04812       errorString.append("needs to be updated to reflect this.)");
04813 
04814       throw cms::Exception("StorageManager","configureAction")
04815         << errorString;
04816     }
04817   } else {
04818     try {
04819       // create a parameter set from the configuration string
04820       PythonProcessDesc py_pdesc(smConfigString_);
04821       boost::shared_ptr<ProcessDesc> pdesc = py_pdesc.processDesc();
04822       boost::shared_ptr<edm::ParameterSet> smPSet = pdesc->getProcessPSet();
04823 
04824       // loop over each end path
04825       std::vector<std::string> allEndPaths = 
04826         smPSet->getParameter<std::vector<std::string> >("@end_paths");
04827       for(std::vector<std::string>::iterator endPathIter = allEndPaths.begin();
04828           endPathIter != allEndPaths.end(); ++endPathIter) {
04829 
04830         // loop over each element in the end path list (not sure why...)
04831         std::vector<std::string> anEndPath =
04832           smPSet->getParameter<std::vector<std::string> >((*endPathIter));
04833         for(std::vector<std::string>::iterator ep2Iter = anEndPath.begin();
04834             ep2Iter != anEndPath.end(); ++ep2Iter) {
04835 
04836           // fetch the end path parameter set
04837           edm::ParameterSet endPathPSet =
04838             smPSet->getParameter<edm::ParameterSet>((*ep2Iter));
04839           if (! endPathPSet.empty()) {
04840             std::string mod_type =
04841               endPathPSet.getParameter<std::string> ("@module_type");
04842             if (mod_type == "EventStreamFileWriter") {
04843               // convert the maxSize parameter value from MB to bytes
04844               long long maxSize = 1048576 *
04845                 (long long) endPathPSet.getParameter<int> ("maxSize");
04846 
04847               // test the maxSize value.  2E13 is somewhat arbitrary,
04848               // but ~18 TeraBytes seems larger than we would realistically
04849               // want, and it will catch stale (byte-based) values greater
04850               // than ~18 MBytes.)
04851               if (maxSize > 2E+13) {
04852                 std::string streamLabel =  endPathPSet.getParameter<std::string> ("streamLabel");
04853                 std::string errorString =  "The maxSize parameter (file size) ";
04854                 errorString.append("for stream ");
04855                 errorString.append(streamLabel);
04856                 errorString.append(" is too large (");
04857                 try {
04858                   errorString.append(boost::lexical_cast<std::string>(maxSize));
04859                 }
04860                 catch (boost::bad_lexical_cast& blcExcpt) {
04861                   errorString.append("???");
04862                 }
04863                 errorString.append(" bytes). ");
04864                 errorString.append("Please check that this parameter is ");
04865                 errorString.append("specified as the number of MBytes, not bytes. ");
04866                 errorString.append("(The units for maxSize was changed from ");
04867                 errorString.append("bytes to MBytes, and it is possible that ");
04868                 errorString.append("your storage manager configuration file ");
04869                 errorString.append("needs to be updated to reflect this.)");
04870                 
04871                 throw cms::Exception("StorageManager","configureAction")
04872                   << errorString;
04873               }
04874             }
04875           }
04876         }
04877       }
04878     }
04879     catch (...) {
04880       // since the maxSize test is just a convenience, we'll ignore
04881       // exceptions and continue normally, for now.
04882     }
04883   }
04884 
04885   if (maxESEventRate_ < 0.0)
04886     maxESEventRate_ = 0.0;
04887   if (maxESDataRate_ < 0.0)
04888     maxESDataRate_ = 0.0;
04889   if (DQMmaxESEventRate_ < 0.0)
04890     DQMmaxESEventRate_ = 0.0;
04891     
04892   xdata::Integer cutoff(1);
04893   if (consumerQueueSize_ < cutoff)
04894     consumerQueueSize_ = cutoff;
04895   if (DQMconsumerQueueSize_ < cutoff)
04896     DQMconsumerQueueSize_ = cutoff;
04897 
04898   // if samples_ is given in the XML config we need to set it
04899   pmeter_->init(samples_, period4samples_);
04900   DQMpmeter_->init(DQMsamples_, DQMperiod4samples_);
04901 
04902   jc_.reset(new stor::JobController(my_config, getApplicationLogger(), &deleteSMBuffer));
04903 
04904   int disks(nLogicalDisk_);
04905 
04906   jc_->setNumberOfFileSystems(disks);
04907   jc_->setFileCatalog(smFileCatalog_);
04908   jc_->setSourceId(sourceId_);
04909 
04910   jc_->setCollateDQM(collateDQM_);
04911   jc_->setArchiveDQM(archiveDQM_);
04912   jc_->setArchiveIntervalDQM(archiveIntervalDQM_);
04913   jc_->setPurgeTimeDQM(purgeTimeDQM_);
04914   jc_->setReadyTimeDQM(readyTimeDQM_);
04915   jc_->setFilePrefixDQM(filePrefixDQM_);
04916   jc_->setUseCompressionDQM(useCompressionDQM_);
04917   jc_->setCompressionLevelDQM(compressionLevelDQM_);
04918   jc_->setFileClosingTestInterval(fileClosingTestInterval_);
04919 
04920   boost::shared_ptr<EventServer>
04921     eventServer(new EventServer(maxESEventRate_, maxESDataRate_,
04922                                 esSelectedHLTOutputModule_,
04923                                 fairShareES_));
04924   jc_->setEventServer(eventServer);
04925   boost::shared_ptr<DQMEventServer> DQMeventServer(new DQMEventServer(DQMmaxESEventRate_));
04926   jc_->setDQMEventServer(DQMeventServer);
04927   boost::shared_ptr<InitMsgCollection> initMsgCollection(new InitMsgCollection());
04928   jc_->setInitMsgCollection(initMsgCollection);
04929   jc_->setSMRBSenderList(&smrbsenders_);
04930 }
04931 
04932 
04933 bool StorageManager::enabling(toolbox::task::WorkLoop* wl)
04934 {
04935   if (reconfigurationRequested_) {
04936     reconfigurationRequested_ = false;
04937 
04938     try {
04939       LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Start re-configuring ...");
04940       this->haltAction();
04941       this->configureAction();
04942       LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Finished re-configuring!");
04943     }
04944     catch (cms::Exception& e) {
04945       reasonForFailedState_ = e.explainSelf();
04946       fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
04947       return false;
04948     }
04949     catch (xcept::Exception &e) {
04950       reasonForFailedState_ = "re-configuring FAILED: " + (string)e.what();
04951       fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
04952       return false;
04953     }
04954     catch (std::exception& e) {
04955       reasonForFailedState_  = e.what();
04956       fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
04957       return false;
04958     }
04959     catch (...) {
04960       reasonForFailedState_  = "Unknown Exception while re-configuring";
04961       fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
04962       return false;
04963     }
04964   }
04965 
04966   try {
04967     LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Start enabling ...");
04968 
04969     smrbsenders_.clear();
04970     
04971     fileList_.clear();
04972     eventsInFile_.clear();
04973     storedEventsInStream_.clear();
04974     fileSize_.clear();
04975     storedEvents_ = 0;
04976     receivedEvents_ = 0;
04977     receivedErrorEvents_ = 0;
04978     storedVolume_ = 0;
04979     receivedVolume_ = 0;
04980     DQMreceivedVolume_ = 0;
04981     receivedEventsFromOutMod_.clear();
04982     namesOfStream_.clear();
04983     namesOfOutMod_.clear();
04984     receivedEventsMap_.clear();
04985     avEventSizeMap_.clear();
04986     avCompressRatioMap_.clear();
04987     modId2ModOutMap_.clear();
04988     storedEventsMap_.clear();
04989     dqmRecords_   = 0;
04990     closedFiles_  = 0;
04991     openFiles_  = 0;
04992     lastEventSeen_ = 0;
04993     lastErrorEventSeen_ = 0;
04994     pmeter_->init(samples_, period4samples_);
04995     DQMpmeter_->init(DQMsamples_, DQMperiod4samples_);
04996     jc_->start();
04997 
04998     boost::shared_ptr<InitMsgCollection> initMsgCollection = jc_->getInitMsgCollection();
04999     if (initMsgCollection.get() != 0) {
05000       initMsgCollection->clear();
05001     }
05002 
05003     LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Finished enabling!");
05004     
05005     fsm_.fireEvent("EnableDone",this);
05006   }
05007   catch (xcept::Exception &e) {
05008     reasonForFailedState_ = "enabling FAILED: " + (string)e.what();
05009     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
05010     return false;
05011   }
05012   catch(...)
05013   {
05014     reasonForFailedState_  = "Unknown Exception while enabling";
05015     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
05016     return false;
05017   }
05018   startMonitoringWorkLoop();
05019   return false;
05020 }
05021 
05022 
05023 bool StorageManager::stopping(toolbox::task::WorkLoop* wl)
05024 {
05025   try {
05026     LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Start stopping ...");
05027 
05028     stopAction();
05029 
05030     LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Finished stopping!");
05031     
05032     fsm_.fireEvent("StopDone",this);
05033   }
05034   catch (xcept::Exception &e) {
05035     reasonForFailedState_ = "stopping FAILED: " + (string)e.what();
05036     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
05037     return false;
05038   }
05039   catch(...)
05040   {
05041     reasonForFailedState_  = "Unknown Exception while stopping";
05042     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
05043     return false;
05044   }
05045   
05046   return false;
05047 }
05048 
05049 
05050 bool StorageManager::halting(toolbox::task::WorkLoop* wl)
05051 {
05052   try {
05053     LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Start halting ...");
05054 
05055     haltAction();
05056     
05057     LOG4CPLUS_INFO(getApplicationLogger(),"Finished halting!");
05058     
05059     fsm_.fireEvent("HaltDone",this);
05060   }
05061   catch (xcept::Exception &e) {
05062     reasonForFailedState_ = "halting FAILED: " + (string)e.what();
05063     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
05064     return false;
05065   }
05066   catch(...)
05067   {
05068     reasonForFailedState_  = "Unknown Exception while halting";
05069     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
05070     return false;
05071   }
05072   
05073   return false;
05074 }
05075 
05076 void StorageManager::stopAction()
05077 {
05078   jc_->stop();
05079   jc_->join();
05080 
05081   // 08-Oct-2008, KAB
05082   // The file statistics need to be determined after we close
05083   // the files, n'est pas?  And since the file closing is
05084   // done underneath jc.stop(), the following code needs
05085   // to come after jc_->stop(), I believe.
05086   std::list<std::string>& files = jc_->get_filelist();
05087   std::list<std::string>& currfiles= jc_->get_currfiles();
05088   closedFiles_ = files.size() - currfiles.size();
05089   openFiles_ = currfiles.size();
05090 
05091   unsigned int totInFile = 0;
05092   for(list<string>::const_iterator it = files.begin();
05093       it != files.end(); ++it)
05094   {
05095       string name;
05096       unsigned int nev;
05097       unsigned long long size;
05098       parseFileEntry((*it),name,nev,size);
05099       fileList_.push_back(name);
05100       eventsInFile_.push_back(nev);
05101       totInFile += nev;
05102       fileSize_.push_back((unsigned int) (size / 1048576));
05103       FDEBUG(5) << name << " " << nev << " " << size << std::endl;
05104   }
05105   receivedEventsFromOutMod_.clear();
05106   namesOfOutMod_.clear();
05107 
05108   boost::shared_ptr<InitMsgCollection> initMsgCollection;
05109   if(jc_.get() != NULL && jc_->getInitMsgCollection().get() != NULL) {
05110     initMsgCollection = jc_->getInitMsgCollection();
05111   }
05112   idMap_iter oi(modId2ModOutMap_.begin()), oe(modId2ModOutMap_.end());
05113   for( ; oi != oe; ++oi) {
05114       std::string outputModuleLabel = oi->second;
05115       if (initMsgCollection.get() != NULL &&
05116           initMsgCollection->getOutputModuleName(oi->first) != "") {
05117         outputModuleLabel = initMsgCollection->getOutputModuleName(oi->first);
05118       }
05119       receivedEventsFromOutMod_.push_back(receivedEventsMap_[oi->second]);
05120       namesOfOutMod_.push_back(outputModuleLabel);
05121   }
05122   storedEvents_ = 0;
05123   storedEventsInStream_.clear();
05124   // following is thread safe as size of all_storedEvents is fixed (number of streams)
05125   std::vector<uint32> all_storedEvents = jc_->get_storedEvents();
05126   for(std::vector<uint32>::iterator it = all_storedEvents.begin(), itEnd = all_storedEvents.end();
05127       it != itEnd; ++it) {
05128       storedEvents_ = storedEvents_ + (*it);
05129       storedEventsInStream_.push_back(*it);
05130   }
05131   
05132   // should clear the event server(s) last event/queue
05133   boost::shared_ptr<EventServer> eventServer;
05134   boost::shared_ptr<DQMEventServer> dqmeventServer;
05135   if (jc_.get() != NULL)
05136   {
05137     eventServer = jc_->getEventServer();
05138     dqmeventServer = jc_->getDQMEventServer();
05139   }
05140   if (eventServer.get() != NULL) eventServer->clearQueue();
05141   if (dqmeventServer.get() != NULL) dqmeventServer->clearQueue();
05142 }
05143 
05144 void StorageManager::haltAction()
05145 {
05146   stopAction();
05147 
05148   // make sure serialized product registry is cleared also as its used
05149   // to check state readiness for web transactions
05150   pushMode_ = false;
05151 
05152   {
05153     boost::mutex::scoped_lock sl(halt_lock_);
05154     jc_.reset();
05155   }
05156 }

05161 xoap::MessageReference StorageManager::fsmCallback(xoap::MessageReference msg)
05162   throw (xoap::exception::Exception)
05163 {
05164   return fsm_.commandCallback(msg);
05165 }
05166 
05167 
05169 void StorageManager::sendDiscardMessage(unsigned int    rbBufferID, 
05170           unsigned int    hltInstance,
05171           unsigned int    msgType,
05172           string          hltClassName)
05173 {
05174   /*
05175   std::cout << "sendDiscardMessage ... " 
05176       << rbBufferID     << "  "
05177       << hltInstance    << "  "
05178       << msgType        << "  "
05179       << hltClassName   << std::endl;
05180   */
05181     
05182   set<xdaq::ApplicationDescriptor*> setOfRBs=
05183     getApplicationContext()->getDefaultZone()->
05184     getApplicationDescriptors(hltClassName.c_str());
05185   
05186   for (set<xdaq::ApplicationDescriptor*>::iterator 
05187    it=setOfRBs.begin();it!=setOfRBs.end();++it)
05188     {
05189       if ((*it)->getInstance()==hltInstance)
05190   {
05191     
05192     stor::FUProxy* proxy =  new stor::FUProxy(getApplicationDescriptor(),
05193                 *it,
05194                 getApplicationContext(),
05195                 pool_);
05196     if ( msgType == I2O_FU_DATA_DISCARD )
05197       proxy -> sendDataDiscard(rbBufferID); 
05198     else if ( msgType == I2O_FU_DQM_DISCARD )
05199       proxy -> sendDQMDiscard(rbBufferID);
05200     else assert("Unknown discard message type" == 0);
05201     delete proxy;
05202   }
05203     }
05204 }
05205 
05206 void StorageManager::startMonitoringWorkLoop() throw (evf::Exception)
05207 {
05208   try {
05209     wlMonitoring_=
05210       toolbox::task::getWorkLoopFactory()->getWorkLoop(sourceId_+"Monitoring",
05211                    "waiting");
05212     if (!wlMonitoring_->isActive()) wlMonitoring_->activate();
05213     asMonitoring_ = toolbox::task::bind(this,&StorageManager::monitoring,
05214               sourceId_+"Monitoring");
05215     wlMonitoring_->submit(asMonitoring_);
05216   }
05217   catch (xcept::Exception& e) {
05218     string msg = "Failed to start workloop 'Monitoring'.";
05219     XCEPT_RETHROW(evf::Exception,msg,e);
05220   }
05221 }
05222 
05223 
05224 bool StorageManager::monitoring(toolbox::task::WorkLoop* wl)
05225 {
05226   // @@EM if state is already "failed" then no reason to firefailed again 
05227   //      (in fact it will cause problems) so bail out !
05228   if(fsm_.stateName()->toString() == "Failed") return false;
05229   // @@EM Look for exceptions in the FragmentCollector thread, do a state transition if present
05230   if(stor::getSMFC_exceptionStatus()) {
05231     edm::LogError("StorageManager") << "Fatal BURP in FragmentCollector thread detected! \n"
05232        << stor::getSMFC_reason4Exception();
05233 
05234     reasonForFailedState_ = stor::getSMFC_reason4Exception();
05235     fsm_.fireFailed(reasonForFailedState_,this);
05236     return false; // stop monitoring workloop after going to failed state
05237   }
05238 
05239   ::sleep(10);
05240   if(jc_.get() != NULL && jc_->getInitMsgCollection().get() != NULL &&
05241      jc_->getInitMsgCollection()->size() > 0) {
05242     boost::mutex::scoped_lock sl(halt_lock_);
05243     if(jc_.use_count() != 0) {
05244       // this is needed only if using flashlist infospace (not for the moment)
05245       std::ostringstream oss;
05246       oss << "urn:xdaq-monitorable:" << class_.value_ << ":" << instance_.value_;
05247       xdata::InfoSpace *is = xdata::InfoSpace::get(oss.str());  
05248       is->lock();
05249 
05250       // now for separate stored events via monitoring loop (temporary solution?)
05251       // following is thread safe as size of all_storedEvents is fixed (number of streams)
05252       std::vector<uint32> all_storedEvents = jc_->get_storedEvents();
05253       if(all_storedEvents.begin() != all_storedEvents.end())
05254       {
05255         // only reset if there are stored events otherwise on stop stats are reset to zero
05256         // we want to keep them for retrieval
05257         storedEvents_ = 0;
05258         storedEventsInStream_.clear();
05259         namesOfStream_.clear();
05260         std::vector<std::string> all_storedNames = jc_->get_storedNames();
05261         for(std::vector<uint32>::iterator it = all_storedEvents.begin(), itEnd = all_storedEvents.end();
05262             it != itEnd; ++it) {
05263               storedEvents_ = storedEvents_ + (*it);
05264               storedEventsInStream_.push_back(*it);
05265         }
05266         for(std::vector<std::string>::iterator it = all_storedNames.begin(), itEnd = all_storedNames.end();
05267             it != itEnd; ++it) {
05268               namesOfStream_.push_back(*it);
05269         }
05270       }
05271       boost::shared_ptr<stor::SMOnlyStats> stored_stats = jc_->get_stats();
05272       store_samples_ = stored_stats->samples_;
05273       store_period4samples_ = stored_stats->period4samples_;
05274       store_instantBandwidth_ = stored_stats->instantBandwidth_;
05275       store_instantRate_ = stored_stats->instantRate_;
05276       store_instantLatency_ = stored_stats->instantLatency_;
05277       store_totalSamples_ = (unsigned long)stored_stats->totalSamples_;
05278       store_duration_ = stored_stats->duration_;
05279       store_meanBandwidth_ = stored_stats->meanBandwidth_;
05280       store_meanRate_ = stored_stats->meanRate_;
05281       store_meanLatency_ = stored_stats->meanLatency_;
05282       store_maxBandwidth_ = stored_stats->maxBandwidth_;
05283       store_minBandwidth_ = stored_stats->minBandwidth_;
05284       store_instantBandwidth2_ = stored_stats->instantBandwidth2_;
05285       store_instantRate2_ = stored_stats->instantRate2_;
05286       store_instantLatency2_ = stored_stats->instantLatency2_;
05287       store_totalSamples2_ = (unsigned long)stored_stats->totalSamples2_;
05288       store_duration2_ = stored_stats->duration2_;
05289       store_meanBandwidth2_ = stored_stats->meanBandwidth2_;
05290       store_meanRate2_ = stored_stats->meanRate2_;
05291       store_meanLatency2_ = stored_stats->meanLatency2_;
05292       store_maxBandwidth2_ = stored_stats->maxBandwidth2_;
05293       store_minBandwidth2_ = stored_stats->minBandwidth2_;
05294       store_receivedVolume_ = stored_stats->receivedVolume_;
05295       storedVolume_   = store_receivedVolume_;
05296 
05297       // end temporary solution
05298       
05299       std::list<std::string>& files = jc_->get_filelist();
05300 
05301       if(files.size()==0){is->unlock(); return true;}
05302       if(streams_.size()==0) {
05303   for(list<string>::const_iterator it = files.begin();
05304       it != files.end(); ++it)
05305     {
05306       string name;
05307       unsigned int nev;
05308       unsigned long long size;
05309       parseFileEntry((*it),name,nev,size);
05310       string sname = findStreamName(name);
05311       if(sname=="" || sname==name) continue;
05312       if(streams_.find(sname) == streams_.end())
05313         streams_.insert(pair<string,streammon>(sname,streammon()));
05314     }
05315   
05316       }
05317       for(ismap it = streams_.begin(); it != streams_.end(); ++it)
05318   {
05319     (*it).second.nclosedfiles_=0;
05320     (*it).second.nevents_ =0;
05321     (*it).second.totSizeInkBytes_=0;
05322   }
05323       
05324       for(list<string>::const_iterator it = files.begin();
05325     it != files.end(); ++it)
05326   {
05327     string name;
05328     unsigned int nev;
05329     unsigned long long size;
05330     parseFileEntry((*it),name,nev,size);
05331     string sname = findStreamName(name);
05332     if(sname=="" || sname==name) continue;
05333     if(streams_.find(sname) == streams_.end())
05334       streams_.insert(pair<string,streammon>(sname,streammon()));
05335     streams_[sname].nclosedfiles_++;
05336     streams_[sname].nevents_ += nev;
05337     streams_[sname].totSizeInkBytes_ += size >> 10;
05338   }
05339       is->unlock();
05340     }
05341     
05342       
05343   }
05344     
05345   return true;
05346 }
05347 
05349 // *** Provides factory method for the instantiation of SM applications
05350 // should probably use the MACRO? Could a XDAQ version change cause problems?
05351 extern "C" xdaq::Application
05352 *instantiate_StorageManager(xdaq::ApplicationStub * stub)
05353 {
05354   std::cout << "Going to construct a StorageManager instance "
05355       << std::endl;
05356   return new stor::StorageManager(stub);
05357 }
